Scene_Texts: Bread. And two of those little fish. And a mug of dark beer to wash it down. And bacon, burnt black. Little brother. Beloved siblings. Is Bran going to die? Apparently not. What do you mean? The Maester says the boy may live. It no mercy, letting a child linger in such pain. Only the gods know for certain. All the rest of us can do is pray. The charms of the north seem entirely lost on you. I still ca not believe you are going. It ridiculous even for you. Where your sense of wonder? The greatest structure ever built, the intrepid men of the Night Watch, the wintry abode of the The White Walkers. Tell me you are not thinking of taking the black. And go celibate? The whores would go begging from Dorne to Casterly Rock. I just want to stand on top of the Wall and piss off the edge of the world. The children do not need to hear your filth. Come. Even if the boy lives, he will be a cripple, a grotesque. Give me a good clean death any day. Speaking for the grotesques, I would have to disagree. Death is so final, whereas life... Life is full of possibilities. I hope the boy does wake. I would be very interested to hear what he has to say. My dear brother, there are times you make me wonder whose side you are on. My dear brother, you wound me. You know how much I love my family.

Scene_Tiitles: Robert Barathaon as a King-Robert lovers and enemies
Specific_Stories: Robert Barathaon as a King-Robert 's Targaryens hatred,Ned Stark as King's Hand- Ned's bastard
Scene_Texts: Gods, this is country! I have half a mind to leave them all behind and keep going. I have half a mind to go with you. What do you say, just you and me on the Kingsroad, swords at our sides, a couple of tavern wenches to warm our beds tonight. You should have asked me 20 years ago. There were wars to fight, women to marry... We never had the chance to be young. I recall a few chances. There was that one... Oh, what was her name? That common girl of yours? Becca? With the great big tits you could bury your face in. Bessie. She was one of yours. Bessie! Thank the gods for Bessie and her tits. Yours was... Aleena? No. You told me once. Meryl? Your bastard mother? Wylla. That it. She must have been a rare wench to make Lord Eddard Stark forget his honor. You never told me what she looked like. Nor will I. We were at war. None of us knew if we were gonna go back home again. You are too hard on yourself. You always have been. I swear if I were not your King, you would have hit me already. The worst thing about your coronation... I will never get to hit you again. Trust me, that not the worst thing. There was a rider in the night. Daenerys Targaryen has wed some Dothraki horselord. What of it? Should we send her a wedding gift? A knife perhaps, a good sharp one, and a bold man to wield it. She little more than a child. Soon enough that child will spread her legs and start breeding. Tell me we are not speaking of this. Oh, it unspeakable to you? What her father did to your family... That was unspeakable. What Rhaegar Targaryen did to your sister... the woman I loved. I will kill every Targaryen I get my hands on. But you ca not get your hands on this one, can you? This Khal Drogo, it said he has 100,000 men in his horde. Even a million Dothraki are no threat to the realm, as long as they remain on the other side of the Narrow Sea. They have no ships, Robert. There are still those in the Seven Kingdoms who call me Usurper. If the Targaryen boy crosses with a Dothraki horde at his back, the scum will join him. He will not cross. And if by chance he does, we will throw him back into the sea. There a war coming, Ned. I do not know when, I do not know who we will be fighting, but

If I would been born a peasant they might have left me out in the woods to die. Alas, I was born a Lannister of Casterly Rock. Things are expected of me. My father was the Hand of the King for 20 years. Until your brother killed that King. Yes, until my brother killed him. Life is full of these little ironies. Well, my brother has his sword and I have my mind. And a mind needs books like a sword needs a whetstone. That why I read so much. And you? What your story, bastard? Scene_Texts: What I am about to tell you must remain between us. I do not think Bran fell from that tower. I think he was thrown. The boy was always sure-footed before. Someone tried to kill him twice. Why? Why murder an innocent child? Unless he saw something he was not meant to see. Saw what, my lady? I do not know. But I would stake my life the Lannisters are involved. We already have reason to suspect their loyalty to the crown. Did you notice the dagger the killer used? It too fine a weapon for such a man. The blade is Valyrian steel, the handle dragonbone. Someone gave it to him. They come into our home and try to murder my brother? If it war they want... If it comes to that, you know I will stand behind you. What, is there going to be a battle in the Godswood? Too easily words of war become acts of war. We do not know the truth yet. Lord Stark must be told of this. I do not trust a raven to carry these words. I will ride to King Landing. No. There must always be a Stark in Winterfell. I will go myself. Mother, you ca not. I must. I will send Hal with a squad of guardsmen to escort you. Too large a party attracts unwanted attention. I do not want the Lannisters to know I am coming. Let me accompany you at least. The Kingsroad can be a dangerous place for a woman alone. What about Bran? I have prayed to the Seven for more than a month. Bran life is in their hands now.

Scene_Texts: I think I heard a noise. Go! My lord! My lord! They found her. She unharmed. Where is she? She been taken directly before the King. Who took her? The Lannisters found her. Specific_Stories: Ned Stark as King's Hand-Ned attacked by Jaime, Jaime Lannister-Ned attacked by Jaime-Jaime killed the mad king
Scene_Texts: Thank the gods you are here, Stark. About time we had some stern northern leadership. Glad to see you are protecting the throne. Sturdy old thing. How many kings' asses have polished it, I wonder? What the line? The King shits and the Hand wipes. Very handsome armor. Not a scratch on it. I know. People have been swinging at me for years, but they always seem to miss. You have chosen your opponents wisely then. I have a knack for it. It must be strange for you coming into this room. I was standing right here when it happened. He was very brave, your brother. Your father too. They did not deserve to die like that. Nobody deserves to die like that. But you just stood there and watched. 500 men just stood there and watched. All the great knights of the Seven Kingdoms. You think anyone said a word, lifted a finger? No, Lord Stark. 500 men and this room was silent as a crypt. Except for the screams, of course, and the Mad King laughing. And later... When I watched the Mad King die, I remembered him laughing as your father burned... It felt like justice. Is that what you tell yourself at night? You are a servant of justice? That you were avenging my father when you shoved your sword in Aerys Targaryen back? Tell me... If I would stabbed the Mad King in the belly instead of the back,, would you admire me more? You served him well, when serving was safe. would you admire me more? You served him well, when serving was safe.

Scene_Tiitles: Ned Stark as King's Hand-Ned Stark met Catelyn Stark
Specific_Stories: Ned Stark as King's Hand-Ned knows the crown is in debt
Scene_Texts: Lord Stark. Lord Varys. I was grievously sorry to hear of your troubles on the Kingsroad. We are all praying for Prince Joffrey full recovery. A shame you did not say a prayer for the butcher son. Renly! You are looking well. And you look tired from the road. I told them this meeting could wait another day, but... But we have a Kingdom to look after. I have hoped to meet you for some time, Lord Stark. No doubt Lady Catelyn has mentioned me. She has, Lord Baelish. I understand you knew my brother Brandon as well. All too well. I still carry a token of his esteem from navel to collarbone. Perhaps you chose the wrong man to duel with. It was not the man that I chose, my Lord. It was Catelyn Tully. A woman worth fighting for, I am sure you will agree. I humbly beg your pardon, my Lord Stark. Grand Maester. How many years has it been? You were a young man. And you served another King. How forgetful of me. This belongs to you, now. Should we begin? Without the King? Winter may be coming, but I am afraid the same cannot be said for my brother. His Grace has many cares. He entrusts some small matters to us that we might lighten the load. We are the lords of small matters here. My brother instructs us to stage a tournament in honor of Lord Stark appointment as Hand of the King. Mmm, how much? 40,000 gold dragons to the champion, 20,000 to the runner-up, 20,000 to the winning archer. Can the treasury bear such expense? I will have to borrow it. The Lannisters will accommodate, I expect. We already owe Lord Tywin 3 million gold. What another 80,000? Are you telling me the Crown is three million in debt? I am telling you the Crown is six million in debt. How could you let this happen? The Master of Coin finds the money. The King and the Hand spend it. I will not believe Jon Arryn allowed Robert to bankrupt the realm. Lord Arryn gave wise and prudent advice, but I fear His Grace does not always listen. " Counting coppers, " he calls it. I will speak to him tomorrow. This tournament is an extravagance we cannot afford. As you will. But still, we would best make our plans. There will be no plans until I speak to Robert. Forgive me, my Lords. I had a long ride. You are the King Hand, Lord Stark, we serve at your pleasure.

Scene_Texts: Please, it nearly healed. It ugly. A King should have scars, you fought off a direwolf. You are a warrior like your father. I am not like him. I did not fight off anything. It bit me and all I did was scream. And the two Stark girls saw it, both of them. That not true. You killed the beast. You only spared the girl because of the love your father bears her father. When Aerys Targaryen sat on the Iron Throne, your father was a rebel and a traitor. Someday you will sit on the throne and the truth will be what you make it. Do I have to marry her? Yes. She very beautiful and young. If you do not like her, you only need to see her on formal occasions and when the time comes, to make little princes and princesses. And if you would rather fuck painted whores, you will fuck painted whores. And if you would rather lie with noble virgins, so be it. You are my darling boy and the world will be exactly as you want it to be. Do something nice for the Stark girl. I do not want to. No, but you will. The occasional kindness will spare you all sorts of trouble down the road. We allow the northerners too much power. They consider themselves our equals. How would you handle them? I would double their taxes and command them to supply 10,000 men to the royal army. A royal army? Why should every lord command his own men? It primitive, no better than the hill tribes. We should have a standing army of men loyal to the Crown, trained by experienced soldiers... Instead of a mob of peasants who have never held pikes in their lives. And if the northerners rebel? Scene_Texts: Go away! Arya, open the door. May I come in? Whose sword is that? Mine. Give it to me. I know this maker mark. This is Mikken work. Where did you get this? This is no toy. And who were you hoping to skewer with Needle? Your sister? Do you know the first thing about sword fighting? Stick 'em with the pointy end. That the essence of it. I was trying to learn. I asked Mycah to practice with me. I asked him. It was my fault. No, sweet girl. You did not kill the butcher boy. I hate them! I hate all of them. The Hound, the Queen and the King and Joffrey and Sansa. Sansa was dragged before the King and Queen... And asked to call the Prince a liar. So was I! He is a liar. Darling, listen to me. Sansa will be married to Joffrey someday. She cannot betray him. She must take his side even when he wrong. But how you can let her marry someone like that? Well... Look at me. You are a Stark of Winterfell. You know our words. Winter is coming. You were born in the long summer. You have never known anything else. But now winter is truly coming. And in the winter, we must protect ourselves, look after one another. Sansa is your sister. I do not hate her. Not really. I do not want to frighten you, but I will not lie to you either. We have come to a dangerous place. We cannot fight a war amongst ourselves. All right? Go on. It yours. I can keep it? Try not to stab your sister with it. If you are going to own a sword, you would better know how to use it.

Scene_Texts: Do not listen to it. Crows are all liars. I know a story about a crow. I hate your stories. I know a story about a boy who hated stories. I could tell you about Ser Duncan the Tall. Those were always your favorites. Those were not my favorites. My favorites were the scary ones. Oh, my sweet summer child. What do you know about fear? Fear is for the winter, when the snows fall a hundred feet deep. Fear is for the long night, when the sun hides for years and children are born and live and die all in darkness. That is the time for fear, my little Lord, when the The White Walkers move through the woods. Thousands of years ago there came a night that lasted a generation. Kings froze to death in their castles, same as the shepherds in their huts. And women smothered their babies rather than see them starve, and wept and felt the tears freeze on their cheeks. So is this the sort of story that you like? In that darkness, the The White Walkers came for the first time. They swept through cities and kingdoms, riding their dead horses, hunting with their packs of pale spiders big as hounds... What are you telling him now? Only what the little Lord wants to hear. Get your supper. I want some time with him. One time she told me the sky is blue because we live inside the eye of a blue-eyed giant named Macumber. Maybe we do. How do you feel? You still do not remember anything? I have seen you climb a thousand times. In the wind, in the rain... A thousand times. You never fall. I did though. It true, is not it... what Maester Luwin says about my legs? I would rather be dead. Do not ever say that. I would rather be dead.

Scene_Tiitles: Robert Barathaon as a King, Ned Stark as King's Hand
Specific_Stories: Robert Barathaon as a King- Jaime killed the mad king
Scene_Texts: It been a long time. But I still remember every face. You remember your first? Of course, your Grace. Who was it? A Tyroshi. Never learned the name. How would you do it? Lance through the heart. Quick one. Lucky for you. Mine was some Tarly boy at the Battle of Summerhall. My horse took an arrow so I was on foot, slogging through the mud. He came running at me, this dumb high-born lad, thinking he could end the rebellion with the single swing of his sword. I knocked him down with the hammer. Gods, I was strong then. Caved in his breastplate. Probably shattered every rib he had. Stood over him, hammer in the air. Right before I brought it down he shouted, " Wait! Wait! "... They never tell you how they all shit themselves. They do not put that part in the songs. Stupid boy. Now the Tarlys bend the knee like everyone else. He could have lingered on the edge of the battle with the smart boys and today his wife would be making him miserable, his sons would be ingrates, and he would be waking three times in the night to piss into a bowl. Wine! Lancel. Gods, what a stupid name. Lancel Lannister. Who named you? Some halfwit with a stutter? What are you doing? It empty, your Grace. What do you mean it empty? There no more wine. Is that what empty means?! So get more. Tell your cousin to get in here. Kingslayer! Get in here. Surrounded by Lannisters. Every time I close my eyes I see their blond hair and their smug, satisfied faces. It must wound your pride, huh? Standing out there like a glorified sentry. Jaime Lannister, son of the mighty Tywin... Forced to mind the door while your King eats and drinks and shits and fucks. So come on. We are telling war stories. Who was your first kill, not counting old men? One of the outlaws in the Brotherhood. I was there that day. You were only a squire, 16 years old. You killed Simon Toyne with a counter riposte. Best move I ever saw. A good fighter, Toyne, but he lacked stamina. Your outlaw... Any last words? I cut his head off, so no. What about Aerys Targaryen? What did the Mad King say when you stabbed him in the back? I never asked. Did he call you a traitor? Did he plead for a reprieve? He said the same thing he would been saying for hours... " Burn them all. " If that all, your Grace

Sometimes a Khal decides his riders have not had a good fight in months and need the practice. Tell them all to stop. You want the entire horde to stop? For how long? Until I command them otherwise. Tell him I do not want my brother harmed. Kill these Dothraki dogs! I am your King! Shall we return to the Khalasar, Khaleesi? You walk.

Scene_Texts: bear balls. You are joking? And his brains and his guts, his lungs and his heart all fried in his own fat. When you are a hundred miles north of the Wall and you ate your last meal a week ago, you leave nothing for the wolves. And how do a bear balls taste? A bit chewy. And what about you, my Lord? What the strangest thing you have eaten? Do Dornish girls count? So you roam the Seven Kingdoms, collaring pickpockets and horse thieves and bringing them here as eager recruits? But it not all of 'em done bad things. Some of 'em just poor lads looking for steady feed. Some of 'em high-born lads looking for glory. They have a better chance finding feed than glory. The Night Watch is a joke to you, is it? Is that what we are, Lannister? An army of jesters in black? You do not have enough men to be an army and aside from Yoren here, none of you are particularly funny. I hope we have provided you with some good stories to tell when you are back in King Landing. But something to think about while you are drinking your wine down there, enjoying your brothels... Half the boys you have seen training will die north of the Wall. Might be a wilding axe that gets them, might be sickness, might just be the cold. They die in pain. And they do it so plump little lords like you can enjoy their summer afternoons in peace and comfort. Do you think I am plump? Listen, Benjen... May I call you Benjen? Call me what you like. I am not sure what I have done to offend you. I have great admiration for the Night Watch. I have great admiration for you as First Ranger. You know, my brother once told me that nothing someone says before the word " but " really counts. But... I do not believe that giants and ghouls and The White Walkers are lurking beyond the Wall. I believe that the only difference between us and the wildlings is that when the Wall went up, our ancestors happened to live on the right side of it. You are right. The wildlings are no different from us. A little rougher maybe. But they are made of meat and bone. I know how to track them and I know how to kill them. It not the wildlings giving me sleepless nights. You have never been north of the Wall, so do not tell me what out there. Are you going below? Keep well, keep warm. Enjoy the capital, brother. I always do. I think he starting to like me. " Going below "? Into the tunnel and out the other side. He will be north of the Wall for a month or two. So you are heading down to King Landing too. Day after tomorrow. I get about half of my recruits from their dungeons. Let share the road. I could use some decent company. I travel a bit on the grubby side, my Lord. Not this time. We will be staying at the finest castles and inns. No one turns away a Lannister.

Scene_Tiitles: Night's watch mission
Specific_Stories: Tyrion Lannister- Tyrion as night's watch
Scene_Texts: How many winters have you seen, Lord Tyrion? Eight... no, nine. All of them brief? They say the winter of my birth was three years long, Maester Aemon. This summer has lasted nine. But reports from the Citadel tell us the days grow shorter. The Starks are always right eventually winter is coming. This one will be long and dark things will come with it. We have been capturing wildlings, more every month. They are fleeing south. The ones who flee... say they have seen the The White Walkers. Yes, and the fishermen of Lannisport say they see mermaids. One of our own rangers swore he saw them kill his companions. He swore it right up to the moment Ned Stark chopped his head off. The Night Watch is the only thing standing between the realm and what lies beyond. And it has become an army of undisciplined boys and tired old men. There are less than a thousand of us now. We ca not man the other castles on the Wall. We ca not properly patrol the wilderness. We have barely enough resources to keep our lads armed and fed. Your sister sits by the side of the King. Tell her we need help. When winter does come, gods help us all if we are not ready.

Scene_Texts: You are late, boy. Tomorrow you will be here at midday. Who are you? Your dancing master, Syrio Forel. Tomorrow you will catch it. Now pick it up. That is not the way, boy. This is not a great sword that is needing two hands to swing it. It too heavy. It is heavy as it needs to be to make you strong. Just so. One hand is all that is needed. Now you are standing all wrong. Turn your body side-face. So. You are skinny. That is good. The target is smaller. Now the grip... Let me see. The grip must be delicate. What if I drop it? The steel must be part of your arm. Can you drop part of your arm? No. Nine years Syrio Forel was first sword to the Sealord of Braavos. He knows these things. You must listen to me, boy. I am a girl. Boy, girl... You are a sword, that is all. That is the grip. You are not holding a battle-axe. You are holding... A needle. Ahhh... Just so. Now we will begin the dance. Remember, child, this is not the dance of the Westeros we are learning... The knight dance, hacking and hammering. This is the Bravo dance... The water dance. It is swift and sudden. All men are made of water, do you know this? If you pierce them, the water leaks out and they die. Now you will try to strike me. Up! Dead. Dead. Very dead. Come. Again, faster.

Scene_Texts: I must say I received a slightly warmer welcome on my last visit. Any man of the Night Watch is welcome at Winterfell. Any man of the Night Watch, but not I, eh, boy? I am not your boy, Lannister. I am Lord of Winterfell while my father is away. Then you might learn a lord courtesy. So it true. Hello Bran. Do you remember anything about what happened? He has no memory of that day. Curious. Why are you here? Would your charming companion be so kind as to kneel? My neck is beginning to hurt. Kneel, Hodor. Do you like to ride, Bran? Yes. Well, I mean I did like to. The boy has lost the use of his legs. What of it? With the right horse and saddle, even a cripple can ride. I am not a cripple. Then I am not a dwarf. My father will rejoice to hear it. I have a gift for you. Give that to your saddler. He will provide the rest. You must shape the horse to the rider. Start with a yearling and teach it to respond to the reins and to the boy voice. Will I really be able to ride? You will. On horseback you will be as tall as any of them. Is this some kind of trick? Why do you want to help him? I have a tender spot in my heart for cripples, bastards and broken things. You have done my brother a kindness. The hospitality of Winterfell is yours. Spare me your false courtesies, Lord Stark. There a brothel outside your walls. There I will find a bed and both of us can sleep easier.

Your loyalty to your captors is touching. Tell me, how do you think Balon Greyjoy would feel if he could see his only surviving son has turned lackey? I still remember seeing my father fleet burn in Lannisport. I believe your uncles were responsible? Must have been a pretty sight. Nothing prettier than watching sailors burn alive. Yes, a great victory for your people. Shame how it all turned out. We were outnumbered 10 to one. A stupid rebellion then. I suppose your father realized that when your brothers died in battle. Now here you are, your enemy squire. Careful, Imp. I have offended you. Forgive me, it been a rough morning. Anyway, do not despair. Scene_Texts: Leg, shoulder, leg. Left foot forward. Good. Now pivot as you deliver the stroke. Put all your weight behind it. What in seven hells is that? They will need an eighth hell to fit him in. Tell them your name. Samwell Tarly, of Horn Hill. I mean, I was of Horn Hill. I have come to take the black. Come to take the black pudding. Well, you could not be any worse than you look. See what he can do. I yield. Please, no more. On your feet. Pick up your sword. Hit him till he finds his feet. It seems they have run short of poachers and thieves down south. Now they send us squealing bloody pigs. Again, harder. Enough! He yielded. Looks like the bastard in love. All right then, lord Snow, you wish to defend your lady love, let make it an exercise. You two. Three of you ought to be sufficient to make lady piggy squeal. All you have got to do is get past the bastard. Are you sure you want to do this? No. Yield yield yield! I yield. We are done for today. Go clean the armory. That all you are good for. Well fought! Piss off. Did he hurt you? I have had worse. You can call me Sam... If you want. My mother calls me Sam. It not going to get any easier, you know? You will have to defend yourself. Why did not you get up and fight? I wanted to. I just could not. Why not? I am a coward. My father always says so. The Wall no place for cowards. You are right. I am sorry. I just... Wanted to thank you. A bloody coward. People saw us talking to him. Now they will think we are cowards too. You are too stupid to be a coward. You are too stupid to be a... Quick now, before summer over. Come on here!

Specific_Stories: Visery Targaryen's claim to the throne-Visery knows nothing about dragons
Scene_Texts: Your Grace? Yes, my dear? They call you the last dragon... They do. You have dragon blood in your veins? It entirely possible. What happened to the dragons? I was told that brave men killed them all. The brave men did not kill dragons. The brave men rode them. Rode them from Valyria to build the greatest civilization this world has ever seen. The breath of the greatest dragon forged the Iron Throne, which the Usurper is keeping warm for me. The swords of the vanquished, a thousand of them... melted together like so many candles. I have always wanted to see a dragon. There is nothing in the world that I would rather see. Really? Why dragons? They can fly. And wherever they are, just a few flaps of their wings and they are somewhere else... Far away. And they can kill. Anyone or anything that tries to hurt them gets burned away to nothing... melted... like so many candles. Seeing a dragon would make me very happy. Well, after 15 years in a pleasure house, I imagine just seeing the sky makes you happy. I was not locked in. I have seen things. What have you seen? I have seen... A man from Asshai with a dagger of real dragonglass. I have seen a man who could change his face the way that other men change their clothes. And I have seen a pirate who wore his weight in gold and whose ship had sails of colored silk. So... Have you seen one? A pirate ship? A dragon. No, the last one died many years before I was born. I will tell you what I have seen their skulls. They used to decorate the throne room in the Red Keep. When I was very young, just 3 or 4, my father used to walk me down the rows and I would recite their names for him. When I got them all right, he would give me a sweet. The ones closest to the door were the last ones they were able to hatch and they were all stunted and wrong. Skulls no bigger than dog skulls. But as you got closer to the Iron Throne... They got bigger and bigger and bigger. There was Ghiscar and Valryon, Vermithrax, Essovius, Archonel, Meraxes, Vhagar... And Balerion the Dread... whose fire forged the Seven Kingdoms into one. What happened to the skulls? I do not know. The Usurper had them smashed to powder, I expect. Scattered to the wind. That very sad. Yes, it is. What did I buy you for? To make me sad? No, your Grace. To teach your sister. To teach my sister how to be a better lover? You think I bought you to make Khal Drogo happy? You pretty little idiot. Go on then. Get on with it.

Scene_Texts: It the Hand tournament that causing all this trouble, my Lords. The King tournament. I assure you the Hand wants no part of it. Call it what you will, Lord Stark Ser, the city is packed with people and more flooding in every day. Last night we had a tavern riot, a brothel fire, three stabbings and a drunken horse race down the Street of Sisters. Dreadful. If you ca not keep the King peace, perhaps the City Watch should be commanded by someone who can. I need more men. You will get 50. Lord Baelish will see it paid for. I will? You found money for a champion purse, you can find money to keep the peace. I will also give you 20 of my household guards till the crowds have left. Thank you, my Lord Hand Ser. They will be put to good use. The sooner this is over, the better. The realm prospers from such events, my Lord. They give the great a chance at glory, and the lowly a respite from their woes. And every inn in the city is full and the whores are walking bow-legged. I am sure the tourney puts coins in many a pocket. Now... If there nothing else, my Lords? This heat.

Scene_Texts: On days like this, I envy you northerners your summer snows. Until tomorrow my Lord. I have been hoping to talk to you about Jon Arryn. Lord Arryn? His death was a great sadness to all of us. I took personal charge of his care, but I could not save him. His sickness struck him very hard and very fast. I saw him in my chambers just the night before he passed. Lord Jon often came to me for counsel. Why? I have been Grand Maester for many years. Kings and Hands have come to me for advice since... What did Jon want the night before he died? He came inquiring after a book. A book? What book? I fear it would be of little interest to you, my Lord. A ponderous tome. I would like to read it.

" " Harkon Umber, first of his name, born to lord Hother Umber and lady Amaryllis Umber in the 183rd year after Aegon landing, at the last hearth. Blue of eye, brown of hair and fair complected, died in his 14th year of a wound sustained As I said, my Lord, a ponderous read. Did Jon Arryn tell you what he wanted with it? He did not, my Lord. And I did not presume to ask. Jon death... Such a tragedy. Did he say anything to you during his final hours? Nothing of import, my Lord. There was one phrase he kept repeating " The seed is strong, " I think it was. " The seed is strong "? What does that mean? The dying mind is a demented mind, Lord Stark. For all the weight they are given, last words are usually as significant as first words. And you are quite certain he died of a natural illness? What else could it be? Poison. A disturbing thought. I do not think it likely. The Hand was loved by all. What sort of man would dare... I have heard it said that poison is a woman weapon. Yes. Women, cravens... and eunuchs. Did you know that lord Varys is a eunuch? Everybody knows that. Yes, yes, of course. How that sort of person found himself on the King Council, I will never know. I have taken enough of your time. No trouble at all, my Lord. It a great honor... Thank you. I will find my own way out.

Scene_Texts: I know for a fact that some of the officers go to that brothel in Mole Town. I would not doubt it. Do not you think it a little bit unfair? Making us take our vows while they sneak off for a little sally on the side? Sally on the side? It silly, is not it? What, we ca not defend the Wall unless we are celibate? It absurd. I did not think you would be so upset about it. Why not? Because I am fat? But I like girls just as much as you do. They might not like me as much. I have never... been with one. You have probably had hundreds. As a matter of fact, I am the same as you. I find that hard to believe. I came very close once. I was alone in a room with a naked girl, but... You did not know where to put it? I know where to put it. Was she... Old and ugly? Young and gorgeous. A whore named Ros. What color hair? Red. I like red hair. And her... Her... You do not want to know. That good? Better. Oh no. So why exactly did you not make love to Ros with the perfect... What my name? Jon Snow? And why is my surname Snow? Because... You are a bastard from the north. I never met my mother. My father would not even tell me her name. I do not know if she living or dead. I do not know if she a noblewoman or a fisherman wife... Or a whore. So I sat there in the brothel as Ros took off her clothes. But I could not do it. Because all I could think was what if I got her pregnant and she had a child, another bastard named Snow? It not a good life for a child. So... You did not know where to put it? Enjoying yourselves? You look cold, boys. It is a bit nippy. A bit nippy, yeah, by the fire, indoors. It still summer. Do you boys even remember the last winter? How long has it been now? What, 10 years? I remember. Was it uncomfortable at Winterfell? Were there days when you just could not get warm, never mind how many fires your servants built? I build my own fires. That admirable. I spent six months out there, beyond the Wall during the last winter. It was supposed to be a two-week mission. We heard a rumor Mance Rayder was planning to attack Eastwatch. So we went out to look for some of his men... Capture them, gather some knowledge. The Wildlings who fight for Mance Rayder are hard men. Harder than you will ever be. They know their country better than we do. They knew there was a storm coming in. So they hid in their caves and waited for it to pass. And we got caught in the open. Wind so strong it yanked 100-foot trees straight from the ground, roots and all. If you took your gloves off to find your cock to have a piss, you lost a finger to the frost. And all in darkness. You do not know cold. Neither of you do. The horses died first. We did not have enough to feed them, to keep them warm. Eating the horses was easy. But later when we started to fall... That was not easy. We should have had a couple of boys like you along, should not we? Soft, fat boys like you. We would have lasted a fortnight on you and still had bones leftover for soup. Soon we will have new recruits and you lot will be passed along to the Lord Commander for assignment and they will call you men of the Night Watch, but you would be fools to believe it. Scene_Texts: Lover quarrel? I am sorry. Do I...? Sansa dear, this is Lord Baelish. He known... An old friend of the family. I have known your mother a long long time. Why do they call you Littlefinger? Arya! Do not be rude! No, it quite all right. When I was a child I was very small and I come from a little spit of land called The Fingers, so you see, it an exceedingly clever nickname. I have been sitting here for days! Start the damn joust before I piss myself! Gods, who is that? Ser Gregor Clegane. They call him the Mountain. The Hound older brother. And his opponent? Ser Hugh of the Vale. He was Jon Arryn squire. Look how far he come. Yes, yes. Enough of the bloody pomp. Have at it! Not what you were expecting? Has anyone ever told you the story of the Mountain and the Hound? Lovely little tale of brotherly love. The Hound was just a pup, six years old maybe. Gregor a few years older, already a big lad, already getting a bit of a reputation. Some lucky boys just born with a talent for violence. One evening... Gregor found his little brother playing with a toy by the fire... Gregor toy, a wooden knight. Gregor never said a word, he just grabbed his brother by the scruff of his neck and shoved his face into the burning coals. Held him there while the boy screamed, while his face melted. There are not very many people who know that story. I will not tell anyone. I promise. No, please do not. If the Hound so much as heard you mention it, I am afraid all the knights in King Landing would not be able to save you.

Scene_Texts: My Lord, Her Grace the Queen. Your Grace. You are missing your tournament. Putting my name on it does not make it mine. I thought we might put what happened on the Kingsroad behind us - the ugliness with the wolves. And forcing you to kill the beast was extreme. Though sometimes we go to extremes where our children are concerned. How is Sansa? She likes it here. The only Stark who does. Favors her mother, not much of the north in her. What are you doing here? I might ask the same of you. What is it you hope to accomplish? The King called on me to serve him and the realm, and that what I will do until he tells me otherwise. You ca not change him. You ca not help him. He will do what he wants, which is all he ever done. You will try your best to pick up the pieces. If that my job, then so be it. You are just a soldier, are not you? You take your orders and you carry on. I suppose it makes sense. Your older brother was trained to lead and you were trained to follow. I was also trained to kill my enemies, Your Grace. As was I.

Scene_Texts: Seven blessings to you, goodfolk! And to you. Boy! Bread, meat and beer, quickly. Good idea, grandfather. I am starving. A song while we wait or? I would rather throw myself down a well. Grandfather, may be your last chance if you are heading north. The only music the northerners know is the howling of wolves! I am sorry, my Lord, we are full up. Every room. My men can sleep in the stable. As for myself, I do not require a large room. Truly, my lord, we have nothing. Is there nothing I can do... to remedy this? You can have my room. There a clever man. You can manage food, I trust? Yoren, dine with me. Aye, my Lord. My Lord of Lannister! Might I entertain you while you eat? I can sing of your father victory at King Landing! Nothing would more likely ruin my supper. Lady Stark! What an unexpected pleasure. I was sorry to have missed you at Winterfell. Lady Stark. I was still Catelyn Tully the last time I stayed here. You, Ser... Is that the black bat of Harrenhal I see embroidered on your coat? It is, my Lady. And is Lady Whent a true and honest friend to my father... Lord Hoster Tully of Riverrun? She is. The red stallion was always a welcome sight at Riverrun. My father counts Jonas Bracken amongst his oldest and most loyal bannermen. Our lord is honored by his trust. I envy your father all his fine friends, but I do not quite see the purpose of this. Knight of House Frey Lord Walder is well, my Lady. He has asked your father for the honor of his presence on his 90th nameday. He plans to take another wife. This man... Came into my house as a guest and there conspired to murder my son, a boy of 10. In the name of King Robert and the good Lords you serve, I call upon you to seize him and help me return him to Winterfell to await the king justice.

Scene_Texts: Life is strange. Not so many years ago we fought as enemies at the Trident. I am glad we never met on the field, Ser Barristan... as is my wife. I do not think the widow life would suit her. You are too modest. I have seen you cut down a dozen great knights. My father once told me you were the best he would ever seen. I never knew the man to be wrong about matters of combat. He was a fine man, your father. What the Mad King did to him was a terrible crime. And that lad... He was a squire until a few months ago. How could he afford a new suit of armor? Perhaps Lord Arryn left him some money? I hear the King wants to joust today. Yes. That will never happen. Robert tends to do what he wants. If the King got what he wanted all the time, we would still be fighting a damned rebellion. It made too small, Your Grace. It will not go. Your mother was a dumb whore with a fat arse. Did you know that? Look at this idiot! One ball and no brains. He ca not even put a man armor on him properly. You are too fat for your armor. Fat? Fat, is it? Is that how you speak to your King? That was funny, is it? Oh, it funny, is it? No, Your Grace. No? You do not like the Hand joke? You are torturing the poor boy. You heard the Hand. The King too fat for his armor! Go find the breastplate stretcher, now! The breastplate stretcher? How long before he figures it out? Maybe you should have one invented. All right, all right. But you watch me out there. I still know how to point a lance. You have no business jousting. Leave that for the young men. Why? Because I am king? Piss on that. I want to hit somebody! And who going to hit you back? Anybody who can. And the last man in his saddle... will be you! There not a man in the Seven Kingdoms would risk hurting you. Are you telling me those cowards would let me win? Aye... Drink. I am not thirsty. Drink. Your King commands it. Gods! Too fat for my armor. Your squire... A Lannister boy? Hmm... A bloody idiot... But Cersei insisted. I have Jon Arryn to thank for her. " Cersei Lannister will make a good match ", he told me. " You will need her father on your side. " I thought being King meant I could do whatever I wanted. Enough of this! Let go watch 'em ride. At least I can smell someone else blood. Robert? What? Oh! An inspiring sight for the people, eh? Come! Bow before your King! Bow, you shits!

Scene_Texts: Remove his hood. On that eve, the captive Imp down-wards from his horse did limp, no more would he preen and primp, in garb of red and gold. This is not the Kingsroad. You said we were riding for Winterfell. I did... often and loudly. Very wise. They will be out in droves, looking for me in the wrong place. Word probably gotten to my father by now. He will be offering a handsome reward. Everyone knows a Lannister always pays his debts. Would you be so good as to untie me? And why would I do that? Why not? Am I going to run? The hill tribes would kill me for my boots. Unless a Shadowcat ate me first. Shadowcats and hill tribes are the least of your concerns. Ah... the Eastern Road. We are going to The Vale. You are taking me to your sister to answer for my imagined crimes. Tell me, Lady Stark. When was the last time you saw your sister? Five years ago. She changed. Scene_Texts: Bran The Iron Islands. Sigil - a Kraken. Words - " We do not sow ". Lords? The Greyjoys. Famed for their skills at archery, navigation and lovemaking. And failed rebellions. Sigil - a stag. - A crowned stag now that Robert King. Good. Words - " Ours is the fury ". Lords - the Baratheons. Mhmm. The Westerlands - sigil - a lion. Hmm... Words - " A Lannister always pays his debts. " No. A common saying, but not their official motto. Lords - the Lannisters. We are still on their words. I do not know them. You do know them. Think. " Unbowed, unbent, unbroken ". That House Martell. " Righteous in wrath ". House Hornwood. " Family, duty, honor ". Those are Tully words... Your mother. Are we playing a game? " Family, duty, honor "... Is that the right order? You know it is. Family comes first? Your mother had to leave Winterfell to protect the family. How can she protect the family, if she not with her family? Your mother sat by your bed for three weeks while you slept. And then she left! When you were born, I was the one who pulled you from your mother. I placed you in her arms. From that moment until the moment she dies, she will love you. Absolutely. Fiercely. Why did she leave? I still ca not tell you, but she will be home soon. Do you know where she is now? Today? No, I do not. Then how can you promise me she will be home soon? Sometimes I worry you are too smart for your own good. I will never shoot another arrow. And where is that written? You need legs to work a bow. Hmm... If the saddle Lord Tyrion designed actually works, you could learn to shoot a bow from horseback. Really? Dothraki boys learn when they are four years old. Why should not you?

Scene_Texts: Shh... Keep it down. You are not supposed to be inside the castle walls. I thought you were supposed to be an important person around here. Important enough for the likes of you. You are not the only nobleman in my life, you know. Who? the Imp? I would call him half a nobleman. Jealous? Why should I be jealous? Anyone with a few coppers in his pocket can own you for the night. What a dwarf like down below? I have always wondered. Might surprise you. Hmm? He good with his fingers too. And his tongue. Generous tipper. I guess gold is cheap for a Lannister. You are jealous. I am a Greyjoy. We have been Lords of the Iron Islands for 300 years. There not a family in Westeros that can look down on us, not even the Lannisters. And what about the Starks? I have been Lord Stark ward since I was eight years old. A " ward ", that a nice word for it. Your father rebelled against King Robert and if he does it again... My father fought for the freedom of his people! What did your father do? Scene_Texts: How is your son, my Lord? He will never walk again. But his mind is sound? So they say. A blessing then. I suffered an early mutilation myself. Some doors close forever... others open in the most unexpected places. May I? If the wrong ears heard what I am about to tell you, off comes my head. And who would mourn poor Varys then? North or South, they sing no songs for spiders. But there are things you must know. You are the King Hand and the King is a fool... your friend, I know, but a fool... and doomed unless you save him. I have been in the capital a month. Why have you waited so long to tell me this? I did not trust you. So why do you trust me now? The Queen is not the only one who has been watching you closely. There are few men of honor in the capital. You are one of them. I would like to believe I am another, strange as that may seem. What sort of doom does the King face? The same sort as Jon Arryn. The tears of Lys, they call it. A rare and costly thing, as clear and tasteless as water. It leaves no trace. Who gave it to him? Some dear friend, no doubt. But which one? There were many. Lord Arryn was a kind and trusting man. There was one boy... all he was he owed to Jon Arryn. The squire, Ser Hugh? Pity what happened to him, just when his life seemed to be going so nicely. If Ser Hugh poisoned him, who paid Ser Hugh? Someone who could afford it. Jon was a man of peace. He was Hand for 17 years -- 17 good years. Why kill him? He started asking questions.

What worse, they botched it. The wolf and the lion will be at each other throats. We will be at war soon, my friend. What good is war now? We are not ready. If one Hand can die, why not a second? This Hand is not the other. We need time. Khal Drogo will not make his move until his son is born. You know how these savages are. " Delay, " you say. " Move fast, " I reply. This is no longer a game for two players. It never was.

Scene_Tiitles: Ned Stark as King's Hand, Robert Barathaon as a King-Robert's illegitimate children-Jon Arryn Death
Specific_Stories: Ned Stark as King's Hand-Robert's illegitimate children-Death of Jon Arryn
Scene_Texts: The first to arrive and the last to leave. I admire your industry. You do move quietly. We all have our qualities. You look a bit lonely today. You should pay a visit to my brothel this evening. First boy is on the house. I think you are mistaking business with pleasure. Am I? All those birds that whisper in your ear, such pretty little things. Trust me, we accommodate all inclinations. Oh, I am sure. Lord Redwyne likes his boys very young, I hear. I am a purveyor of beauty and discretion, both equally important. Though I suppose beauty is a subjective quality, no? Is it true that Ser Marlon of Tumblestone prefers amputees? All desires are valid to a man with a full purse. And I heard the most awful rumor about a certain lord with a taste for fresh cadavers. Must be enormously difficult to accommodate that inclination. The logistics alone... to find beautiful corpses before they rot. Strictly speaking, such a thing would not be in accordance with the King laws. Strictly speaking. Tell me. Does someone, somewhere, keep your balls in a little box? I have often wondered. Do you know, I have no idea where they are? And we had been so close. But enough about me. How have you been since we last saw each other? Since you last saw me or since I last saw you? Now the last time I saw you, you were talking to the Hand of the King. Saw me with your own eyes? Eyes I own. Council business. We all have so much to discuss with Ned Stark. Everyone well aware of your enduring fondness for Lord Stark wife. If the Lannisters were behind the attempt on the Stark boy life and it was discovered that you helped the Starks come to that conclusion... To think... A simple word to the Queen... One shudders at the thought. Oh. But you know something? I do believe that I have seen you even more recently than you have seen me. Have you? Yes. Earlier today, I distinctly recall seeing you talking to Lord Stark in his chambers. Was that you under the bed? And not long after that when I saw you escorting a certain foreign dignitary... Council business? Of course you would have friends from across The Narrow Sea. You are from there yourself, after all. We are friends, are not we, Lord Varys? I would like to think we are. So you can imagine my burden, wondering if the King might question my friend sympathies... To stand at a crossroads where turning left means loyalty to a friend, turning right, loyalty to the realm. Oh, please. To find myself in a position where a simple word to the King -- What are you two conspiring about? Well, whatever it is, you would best hurry up. My brother is coming. To a small council meeting? Disturbing news from far away. Have not you heard?

Scene_Tiitles: Robert Barathaon as a King,  Ned Stark as King's Hand
Specific_Stories: Ned Stark as King's Hand-Robert knows Daenerys is pregnant,Robert Baratheon-Robert knows Daenerys is pregnant
Scene_Texts: Lord Stark, your presence has been requested in the small council chamber. A meeting has been called. I need to see the King first -- alone. The King is at the small council meeting, my Lord. He has summoned you. Is it about my wife? No, my Lord. I believe it concerns Daenerys Targaryen. The whore is pregnant. You are speaking of murdering a child. I warned you this would happen. Back in the North, I warned you, but you did not care to hear. Well, hear it now. I want 'em dead, mother and child both. And that fool, Viserys as well. Is that plain enough for you? I want them both dead. You will dishonor yourself forever if you do this. Honor?! I have got Seven Kingdoms to rule! One King, Seven Kingdoms. Do you think honor keeps them in line? Do you think it honor that keeping the peace? It fear! Fear and blood! Then we are no better than the Mad King. Careful, Ned. Careful now. You want to assassinate a girl... Because the Spider heard a rumor? No rumor, my Lord. The princess is with child. Based on whose information? Ser Jorah Mormont. He is serving as adviser to the Targaryens. Mormont? You bring us the whispers of a traitor half a world away and call it fact? Jorah Mormont a slaver, not a traitor. Small difference, I know, to an honorable man. He broke the law, betrayed his family, fled our land. We commit murder on the word of this man? And if he right? If she has a son? A Targaryen at the head of a Dothraki army... What then? The Narrow Sea still lies between us. I will fear the Dothraki the day they teach their horses to run on water. Do nothing? That your wise advice? Do nothing til our enemies are on our shores? You are my council? Counsel! Speak sense to this honorable fool. I understand your misgivings, my Lord. Truly, I do. It is a terrible thing we must consider, a vile thing. Yet, we who presume to rule must sometimes do vile things for the good of the realm. Should the gods grant Daenerys a son, the realm will bleed. I bear this girl no ill will, but should the Dothraki invade, how many innocents will die? How many towns will burn? Is it not wiser, kinder even, that she should die now so that tens of thousands might live? We should have had them both killed years ago. When you find yourself in bed with an ugly woman, best close your eyes, get it over with. Cut her throat. Be done with it. I followed you into war - twice, without doubts, without second thoughts. But I will not follow you now. The Robert I grew up with did not tremble at the shadow of an unborn child. She dies. I will have no part in it. You are the King Hand, Lord Stark. You will do as I command or I will find me a Hand who will. And good luck to him. I thought you were a better man. Out! Out, damn you! I am done with you. Go! Run back to Winterfell! I will have your head on a spike! I will put it there myself, you fool! You think you are too good for this? Too proud and honorable? This is a war!

If you are still here come nightfall, I will take you to see the last person Jon Arryn spoke with before falling ill. If that sort of thing still interests you. I do not have the time. It will not take more than an hour. But as you please. Round up all the men we have and station them outside the girls' chambers. Who are your best two swords? Heward and Wyl. And strong too. Jon knew it. His last words were, " the seed is strong. " He wanted everyone to know what a good, strong boy his son would grow up to be. Look at him, the Lord of all the Vale. Lysa, you wrote me about the Lannisters, warning me t- To stay away from them! Not to bring one here! Mommy? Is that the bad man? It is. He little. He Tyrion the Imp of House Lannister. He killed your father. He murdered the Hand of the King! Oh? Did I kill him too? I have been a very busy man. You will watch your tongue! These men are Knights of the Vale. Every one of the loved Jon Arryn. Every one of them would die for me. If any harm comes to me, my brother, Jaime, will see that they do. You ca not hurt us! No one can hurt us here! Tell him, mommy! Tell him! Shh... Shh... Shh, my sweet boy. He just trying to frighten us. Lannisters are all liars. No one will hurt my baby. Mommy... I want to see the bad man fly. Perhaps you will, my little love. This man is my prisoner. I will not have him harmed. Ser Vardis, my sister guest is weary. Take him down below so he can rest. Introduce him to Mord.

Scene_Tiitles: Renly Baratheon's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Renly Baratheon-Renly wants to be a king
Scene_Texts: Lord Stark lucky he still has a head. Robert will rant for a few days, but he will not do anything. He adores the man. You are jealous. Are you sure this will not hurt? Only if I slip. And you prefer me like this? Mhmm. If you want hairless, maybe you should find a little boy. I want you. My brother thinks that anyone who has not been to war is not a man. He treats me as if I am a spoiled child. Oh, and you are not? Loras Tyrell, the Knight of the Flowers? How many wars have you fought in? Oh, and how much did your father spend on that armor of yours? Hold still. All I ever hear from Robert and Stannis is how I am not tough enough, how I squirm at the sight of blood. You did vomit when that boy eye was knocked out in the mle. His eye was dangling out of the damn socket! He should not have entered the mle if he did not know how to fight. Easy for you to say. Not everyone is such a gifted swordsman. It not a gift. No one gave it to me. I am good because I work at it -- every day of my life since I could hold a stick. I could work at fighting all day, every day, and still never be as good as you. Yes well, I guess we will never know. Everywhere? Everywhere. So how did it end up? The Targaryen girl will die? It needs to be done, unpleasant as it is. Robert rather tasteless about it. Every time he talks about killing her, I swear the table rises six inches. It a shame he ca not muster the same enthusiasm for his wife. He does have a deep, abiding lust for her money. You have to give it to the Lannisters, they may be the most pompous, ponderous cunts the gods ever suffered to walk the world, but they do have outrageous amounts of money. I have an outrageous amount of money. Not as much as the Lannisters. But a lot more than you. Robert threatening to take me hunting with him. Last time we were out there for two weeks, tramping through the trees in the rain, day after day. All so he can stick his spear into something flesh! Oh. but Robert loves his killing. And he the King. Hmm... How did that ever happen? Because he loves his killing and he used to be good at it. Do you know who should be King? Be serious. I am. My father could be your bank. I have never fought in a war before, but I would fight for you. I am fourth in line. And where was Robert in the line of royal succession? Joffrey is a monster. Tommen is eight. Stannis? Stannis has the personality of a lobster. He still my older brother. What are you doing?! Look at it. You cut me! It just blood. We have all got it in us. Sometimes a little spills. If you become King, you are going to see a lot of this. You need to get used to it. Go on. Look. People love you. They love to serve you because you are kind to them. They want to be near you. You are willing to do what needs to be done, but you do not gloat over it. You do not love killing. Where is it written that power is the sole province of the worst? That thrones are only made for the hated and the feared. You would be a wonderful King.

Scene_Tiitles: Robert Barathaon as a King,  Ned Stark as King's Hand, Daenerys Targaryen's claim to the throne-Daenerys Targaryen is pregnant
Specific_Stories: Robert Barathaon as a King- Robert love-Ned Resigned, Cersei Lannister-Robert love
Scene_Texts: I am sorry your marriage to Ned Stark did not work out. You seemed so good together. I am glad I could do something to make you happy. Without a Hand, everything will fall to pieces. I suppose this is where you tell me to give the job to your brother Jaime. No. He not serious enough. I will say this for Ned Stark - he serious enough. Was it really worth it? Losing him this way? I do not know. But I do know this, if the Targaryen girl convinces her horse-lord husband to invade and the Dothraki horde crosses The Narrow Sea... We will not be able to stop them. The Dothraki do not sail. Every child knows that. They do not have discipline. They do not have armor. They do not have siege weapons. It a neat little trick you do, you move your lips and your father voice comes out. Is my father wrong? Let say Viserys Targaryen lands with forty thousand Dothraki screamers at his back. We hole up in our castles, a wise move. Only a fool would meet the Dothraki in an open field. They leave us in our castles. They go from town to town, looting and burning, killing every man who ca not hide behind a stone wall, stealing all our crops and livestock, enslaving all our women and children. How long do the people of the Seven Kingdoms stand behind their absentee King, their cowardly King hiding behind high walls? When do the people decide that Viserys Targaryen is the rightful monarch after all. We still outnumber them. Which is the bigger number -- five or one? Five. Five... one. One army, a real army, united behind one leader with one purpose. Our purpose died with the Mad King. Now we have got as many armies as there are men with gold in their purse. And everybody wants something different. Your father wants to own the world. Ned Stark wants to run away and bury his head in the snow. What do you want? We have not had a real fight in nine years. Back-stabbing does not prepare you for a fight. And that all the realm is now, back-stabbing and scheming and arse-licking and money-grubbing. Sometimes I do not know what holds it together. Our marriage. Ah, so here we sit, seventeen years later, holding it all together. Do not you get tired? Every day. How long can hate hold a thing together? Well, seventeen years is quite a long time. Yes, it is. Yes, it tis. What was she like? You have never asked about her, not once. Why not? At first, just saying her name, even in private felt like I was breathing life back into her. I thought if I did not talk about her, she would just fade away for you. When I realized that was not going to happen, I refused to ask out of spite. I did not want to give you the satisfaction of thinking I cared enough to ask. And eventually it became clear that my spite did not mean anything to you, as far as I could tell, you actually enjoyed it. So why now? What harm could Lyanna Stark ghost do to either of us that we have not done to each other a hundred times over? You want to know the horrible truth? I ca not even remember what she looked like. I only know she was the one thing I ever wanted... Someone took her away from me, and Seven Kingdoms could not fill the hole she left behind. I felt something for you once, you know? I know. Even after we lost our first boy -- for quite a while, actually. Was it ever possible for us? Was there ever a time, ever a... moment? No. Does that make you feel better or worse? It does not make me feel anything.

And tell him I have been with no one else. I swear it, my Lord, by the old gods and new. I do not want no jewels or nothing, just him. The King was always good to me. When Jon Arryn came to visit you, what did he want? He was not that sort of man, my Lord. He just wanted to know if the child was happy, healthy. She looks healthy enough to me. I remember him well. It seems he had some trouble on the road. You would not know what happened to him, would you? He was taken at my command to answer for his crimes. My Lords! As in, " I am going to open your Lord from balls to brains and see what Starks are made of "? You kill me, your brother a dead man. You are right. Take him alive! Kill his men! My brother, Lord Stark... We want him back.

Specific_Stories: Ned Stark as King's Hand-Ned attacked by Jaime,Jaime Lannister- Jaime scaped
Scene_Texts: Your pardon, your Grace. Do you know what your wife has done? She did nothing I did not command. Who would have thought she had it in her? By what right dare you lay hands on my blood? I am the King Hand - You were the King Hand! - trying to keep the peace - You shall now be held accountable. Oh, will both of you shut your mouths? Catelyn will release Tyrion and you will make your peace with Jaime. He butchered my men. Lord Stark was returning drunk from a brothel when his men attacked Jaime. Quiet, woman. Jaime has fled the city. Give me leave to bring him back to justice. I took you for a king. Hold your tongue. He attacked my brother and abducted the other. I should wear the armor and you the gown. I shall wear this like a badge of honor. Wear it in silence or I will honor you again. See what she does to me? My loving wife. I should not have hit her. That was not... That was not kingly. If we do not act... there will be a war. So tell your wife to return that little shit of an Imp to King Landing. She had her fun, now put an end to it. You hear me? Send a raven and put an end to it. And what about Jaime Lannister? What about Jaime? I am half a kingdom in debt to his bloody father. I do not know what happened between you and those yellow-haired shits. I do not want to know. This is what matters - I ca not rule the kingdoms if the Starks and the Lannisters are at each other throats, so enough! As you command your Grace. With your leave, I will return to Winterfell and set matters straight. Piss on that! Send a raven. I want you to stay. I am the king, I get what I want... I never loved my brothers. A sad thing for a man to admit, but it true. You were the brother I chose. We will talk when I return from the hunt. The hunt? Killing things clears my head. You will have to sit on the throne while I am away. You will hate it more than I do. The Targaryen girl - Seven hells! Do not start with her again! The girl will die and I will hear no more of it. Put on the badge. And if you ever take it off again, I swear to the Mother I will pin the damn thing on Jaime Lannister.

When they captured me they took my purse, but the gold is still mine. Where? Where? I do not know where, but when they free me - You want free? Go be free. Have you ever heard the phrase " Rich as a Lannister "? Of course you have. You are a smart man. You know who the Lannisters are. I am a Lannister. Tyrion, son of Tywin! And of course, you have also heard the phrase, " a Lannister always pays his debts. " If you deliver a message from me to Lady Arryn, I will be in your debt. I will owe you gold. Scene_Tiitles: Bran Stark's Journey-Bran Stark Assasination-Tyrion Lannister arrest and trial, Tyrion Lannister's Journey
Specific_Stories: Tyrion Lannister- Tyrion arrested by Catelyn-Tryion trial by combat
Scene_Texts: You wish to confess your crimes? Yes, my lady. I do, my lady. Skycells always break them. Speak, Imp. Meet your gods as an honest man. Where do I begin, my lords and ladies? I am a vile man, I confess it. My crimes and sins are beyond counting. I have lied and cheated, gambled and whored. I am not particularly good at violence, but I am good at convincing others to do violence for me. You want specifics, I suppose. When I was seven, I saw a servant girl bathing in the river. I stole her robe. She was forced to return to the castle, naked and in tears. I close my eyes, I can still see her tits bouncing. When I was ten, I stuffed my uncle boots with goatshit. When confronted with my crime, I blamed a squire. Poor boy was flogged and... I escaped justice. When I was twelve, I milked my eel into a pot of turtle stew. I flogged the one-eyed snake. I skinned my sausage. I made the bald man cry into the turtle stew, which I do believe my sister ate. At least I hope she did. I once brought a jackass and a honeycomb into a brothel - Silence! What happened next?! What do you think you are doing? Confessing my crimes. Lord Tyrion, you are accused of hiring a man to slay my son Bran in his bed, and of conspiring to murder my sister husband ; Lord Jon Arryn, the Hand of the King. Oh, I am very sorry. I do not know anything about all that. You have had your little joke. I trust you enjoyed it. Mord, take him back to the dungeon. But this time find a smaller cell, with a steeper floor. Is this how justice is done in the Vale? you accuse me of crimes, I deny them, so you throw me in a cell to freeze and starve? Where is the King Justice? I am accused and demand a trial. If you are tried and found guilty, then by the king own laws you will pay with your life. I understand the law. We have no executioner in the Eyrie. Life is more elegant here. Open the Moon Door. You want a trial, my Lord Lannister. Very well. My son will listen to whatever you have to say, and you will hear his judgement. Then you will leave, by one door or the other. No need to bother Lord Robin. I demand a trial by combat. You have that right. My lady, I beg the honor. Let me be your champion. The honor should be mine. For the love I bore your lord husband let me avenge his death. I will fight for you, my Lady. It will be my honor. The honor should be mine. Make the bad man fly! Ser Vardis... You are quiet. Did you want to avenge my husband? With all my heart, my Lady. But the Imp is half my size. It would be shameful to slaughter such a man and call it justice. Agreed. You demanded a trial by combat. Now I demand a champion. I have that right, same as you. My Lady, I would gladly fight the Imp champion for you. I would not be too glad, ser. I name my brother, Jaime Lannister. The Kingslayer is hundreds of miles from here. Send a raven for him, I am happy to wait. The trial will be today. Do I have a volunteer? Anyone?... Anyone? I think that we can assume that no one is willing - I will stand for the dwarf.
Scene_Keybords: ladi turtle justice trial crime champion demand confess

Scene_Texts: More wine, your Grace? Oh, what was I saying? A simpler time. It was! It was. You are too young to remember. Was not it, Selmy? It was, your Grace. The enemy was right there in the open, vicious as you like, all but sending you a bloody invitation. Nothing like today. Sounds exhilarating. Exhilarating, yes. Not as exhilarating as those balls and masquerades you like to throw. You ever fucked a Riverlands girl? Once, I think. You think? I think you would remember. Back in our day, you were not a real man until you fucked a girl from each of the Seven Kingdoms and the Riverlands. We called it " making the eight. " Those were some lucky girls. You ever make the eight, Barristan? I do not believe so, your Grace. Those were the days! What days were those? The ones where half of Westeros fought the other half and millions died? Or before that, when the Mad King slaughtered women and babies because the voices in his head told him they deserved it? Or way before that when dragons burned whole cities to the ground? Easy, boy. You might be my brother, but you are speaking to the King. I suppose it was all rather heroic. If you were drunk enough and had some poor Riverlands whore to shove your price inside and " make the eight. " More wine, your Grace?

Scene_Tiitles: Ned Stark as King's Hand-Dispensing justice
Specific_Stories: Ned Stark as King's Hand- Ned giving justice
Scene_Texts: They burned most everything in the Riverlands, our fields, our granaries, our homes. They took our women and then they took 'em again. When they was done, they butchered them as if they was animals. They covered our children in pitch and lit them on fire. Brigands, most likely. They were not thieves, they did not steal nothing. They even left something behind, your Grace. It the King Hand you are addressing, not the king. The king is hunting. Fish. The sigil of House Tully. Is not that your wife House - Tully - my Lord Hand? These men, were they flying a sigil?... A banner. None, your... Hand. The one who was leading them... Taller by a foot than any man I have ever met, saw him cut the blacksmith, saw him take the head off a horse with a single swing of his sword. That sounds like someone we know. The Mountain. You are describing Ser Gregor Clegane. Why should Ser Gregor turn brigand? The man is an anointed knight. I have heard him called " Tywin Lannister mad dog. " I am sure you have as well. Can you think of any reason the Lannisters might possibly have for being angry with your wife? If the Lannisters were to order attacks on villages under the king protection, it would be - It would be almost as brazen as attacking the Hand of the King in the streets of the capital. Wel... I cannot give you back your homes or restore your dead to life. But perhaps I can give you justice in the name of our king, Robert. Lord Beric Dondarrion. You shall have the command. Assemble 100 men and ride to Ser Gregor keep. As you command. In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, the First of his Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm, I charge you to bring the king justice to the false knight Gregor Clegane and all those who shared in his crimes. I denounce him and attaint him. I strip him of all ranks and titles of all lands and holdings, and sentence him to death. My lord... This... This is a drastic action. It would be better to wait for King Robert return. Grand Maester Pycelle. My Lord. Send a raven to Casterly Rock. Inform Tywin Lannister that he has been summoned to court to answer for the crimes of his bannermen. He will arrive within the fortnight, or be branded an enemy of the crown and a traitor to the realm. A bold move, my Lord, and admirable. But is it wise to yank the lion tail? Tywin Lannister is the richest man in all the Seven Kingdoms. Gold wins wars, not soldiers. Then how come Robert is king and not Tywin Lannister?

Would you like to? No. Where are you from anyway, the north or the south? I come from a very small village in - Oh, wait. I just realized... I do not care. Sansa - Septa. Now you are being rude. My prince. My prince. My lady. I fear I have behaved monstrously the past few weeks. With your permission? It beautiful. Like the one your mother wears. You will be queen one day, it only fitting that you should look the part. Will you forgive me for my rudeness? There nothing to forgive. You are my lady. One day we will be married in the throne room. Lords and ladies from all over the Seven Kingdoms will come, from the last hearth in the North, to the salt shore of the south. And you will be queen over all of them. I will never disrespect you again. I will never be cruel to you again. Do you understand me? You are my lady now, from this day, until my last day.

Scene_Texts: " Summoned to court to answer for the crimes of your bannerman Gregor Clegane, the Mountain " Uh, "arrive within the fortnight or be branded an enemy of the Crown." Poor Ned Stark. Brave man, terrible judgment. Attacking him was stupid. Lannisters do not act like fools. Are you gonna say something clever? Go on, say something clever. Catelyn Stark took my brother. Why is he still alive? Tyrion? Ned Stark. One of our men interfered, speared him through the leg before I could finish him. Why is he still alive? It would not have been clean. Clean... You spend too much time worrying about what other people think of you. I could care less what anyone thinks of me. Now that what you want people to think of you. It the truth. When you hear them whispering " Kingslayer " behind your back, does not it bother you? Of course it bothers me. The lion does not concern himself with the opinions of the sheep. I suppose I should be grateful that your vanity got in the way of your recklessness. I am giving you half of our forces. 30,000 men. You will bring them to Catelyn Stark girlhood home and remind her that Lannisters pay their debts. I did not realize you placed such a high value on my brother life. He a Lannister. HHe might be the lowest of the Lannisters, but he one of us. And every day that he remains a prisoner, the less our name commands respect. So the lion does concern himself with the opinions of.. No, it not an opinion, it a fact! If another House can seize one of our own and hold him captive with impunity, we are no longer a House to be feared. Your mother dead. Before long I will be dead. And you and your brother and your sister and all of her children. All of us dead, all of us rotting in the ground. It the family name that lives on. It all that lives on. Not your personal glory, not your honor, but family. Do you understand? Hmm. You are blessed with abilities that few men possess. You are blessed to belong to the most powerful family in the kingdoms. And you are still blessed with youth. And what have you done with these blessings, huh? You have served as a glorified bodyguard for two kings. One a madman, the other a drunk. The future of our family will be determined in these next few months. We could establish a dynasty that will last a thousand years. Or we could collapse into nothing, as the Targaryens did. I need you to become a man you were always meant to be. Not next year. Not tomorrow. Now.

Scene_Tiitles: Ned Stark as King's Hand, Cersei Lannister as a queen
Specific_Stories: Ned Stark as King's Hand-Ned attacked by Jaime
Scene_Texts: You are in pain. I have had worse, my lady. Perhaps it time to go home. The South does not seem to agree with you. I know the truth Jon Arryn died for. Do you, Lord Stark? Is that why you called me here, to pose me riddles? Has he done this before? Jaime would have killed him. My brother is worth a thousand of your friend. Your brother Or your lover? The Targaryens wed brothers and sisters for 300 years to keep bloodlines pure. Jaime and I are more than brother and sister. We shared a womb. We came into this world together. We belong together. My son saw you with him. Do you love your children? With all my heart. No more than I love mine. And they are all Jaime. Thank the Gods. In the rare event that Robert leaves his whores for long enough to stumble drunk into my bed, I finish him off in other ways. In the morning, he does not remember. You have always hated him. Hated him? I worshiped him. I worshiped him. Every girl in the Seven Kingdoms dreamed of him, but he was mine by oath. And when I finally saw him on our wedding day in the Sept of Baelor, lean and fierce and black-bearded, it was the happiest moment of my life. Then that night he crawled on top of me, stinking of wine and did what he did, what little he could do, and whispered in my ear, "Lyanna". Your sister was a corpse and I was a living girl and he loved her more than me. When the King returns from his hunt, I will tell him the truth. You must be gone by then. You and your children. I will not have their blood on my hands. Go as far away as you can, with as many men as you can. Because wherever you go, Robert wrath will follow you. And what of my wrath, Lord Stark? You should have taken the realm for yourself. Jaime told me about the day King Landing fell. He was sitting in the Iron Throne and you made him give it up. All you needed to do was climb the steps yourself. Such a sad mistake. I have made many mistakes in my life, but that was not one of them. Oh, but it was. When you play the Game of Thrones, you win or you die. There is no middle ground.
