Scene_Texts: Is it as you remember my lord? Looks smaller. Everything looks bigger when you are a child. I remember my father cabin, felt like a palace when I was little. Now look at it. They will be waiting for me on the docks. Who will? Anyone who matters,, this is a big day for them. They have not had much to get excited about since I left. It a hard place the Iron Islands always has been. It cold and it wet. I love the cold and wet. They say hard places breed hard men,, and hard men rule the world. Then you will be king before long. Try smiling with your lips closed. Hmm, better. My father does not trust you Iron islanders. I do not blame him. He says that you are all reavers and rapers. Scene_Texts: I barely touched her. And you charge twice as much as every other brothel. And this is what I get, crying. One moment, my friend. A moment. Please accept my sincerest apologies. Ramka will take good care of you. I am sorry, my lord. Shhh. Did he hurt you? No, my lord... It Mhaegen. Who? She works for you. She the one, the girl whose, they killed her baby. Ah, yes, that was poorly handled. Sometimes those with the most power have the least grace. Ca not stop thinking about it, I ca not sleep. Her poor little baby. You know, you remind me of another girl. A lovely thing I once acquired from an Elysium pleasure house. Beautiful, like yourself, and intelligent as yourself. But she was not happy. She cried, often. I asked her why but, we did not have the kind of rapport that you and I have. Yes, it was quite sad. Girls from Elysium pleasure houses are expensive. Extremely expensive. And this one was not making me any money. I hate bad investments. Really, I do. They haunt me. I had no idea how to make her happy, no idea how to mitigate my losses. A very wealthy patron, he offered me a tremendous amount of money to let him transform this lovely, sad girl. To use her in ways that never occur to most men. And you know what occurs to most men. I would not say he succeeded in making her happy but my losses were definitely mitigated. Take tonight off to mourn Mhaegen child. I will see you tomorrow. But you will be happy?. That makes me happy.

Scene_Texts: More wine? Damn it, boy! Apologies, my lord. Leave us, Podrick. I believe we know how to pour our own wine. Is that your new squire? Could have found you a proper lad. Myself, I prefer the improper ones. Hmm, that a good red. Dornish? You know your wines, my lord. That I do. A fine dinner, my lord. Call me Tyrion, please. I am sure you are getting used to fine dinners, now that you are a lord. Maybe I will hire this cook of yours. Wars have been started for less. I heard there was some trouble in Littlefinger brothel the other night. Hmm. Nasty business, had to be done. Yes, of course. City Watch must keep the peace. Only, I had not realized peace depended on killing babies. Orders are orders. Quite right. Especially the queen orders. I never said they were the queen orders. No, but who else would want to murder King Robert bastards? She always been a jealous woman. You know your sister better than I do. You have heard the awful rumors about my brother and sister. I do not listen to filth. That good of you, but you have heard them. I suppose people who do believe that filth, consider Robert bastards to be better claimants to the throne than Cersei children. Joffrey is my king, the rest does not interest me. I appreciate your loyalty. Tell me. When your men slaughtered Ned Stark men in the throne room, did you give the order? I did. And I would again. The man was a traitor. He tried to buy my loyalty. The fool! He had no idea you were already bought. Are you drunk? I will not have my honor questioned by an Imp. I am not questioning your honor, Lord Janos. I am denying its existence. You think I will stand here and take this from you, dwarf. Dwarf? You should have stopped at imp. And yes, you will stand here and take it from me, unless you would like to take it from my friend here. I intend to serve as Hand of the King until my father returns from the war, and seeing as you betrayed the last Hand of the King, well, I just would not feel safe with you lurking about. What are you ta- My friends at court will not allow this. The queen herself - The queen regent. And you are a fool to believe she your friend. We shall hear what Joffrey has to say about this. No, we sha not. There a ship leaving for East Watch by the sea tonight. From there, I am afraid it rather a long walk to Castle Black. I hope you enjoy the Wall. I found it surprisingly beautiful, in a brutal, horribly uncomfortable sort of way. The lads will escort you. The streets are not safe at night, my lord. These men are under my command. I command you to arrest this cutthroat. His name is Bronn... and he is the new commander of the City Watch. Boys? I have friends at court! Powerful friends! The king himself made me a lord! To the new Commander. If I told you to murder, an infant girl say, still at her mother breast, would you do it without question? Without question? No. I would ask how much.

Scene_Texts: If they come back, I say we yield. Gendry the one they want. I do not want to get caught in the middle of a battle. I am not afraid of no battles. If you got within a mile of a battle, you would fill your pants. I have seen lots of battles. I saw - Liar. I saw a man kill another man just outside a tavern in Flea Bottom. Stabbed him right in the neck. Two men fighting is not a battle. They had armor on. So? So, if they got armor on, it a battle. No, it is not. What a dyer apprentice know about battles anyway?. Gendry an armorer apprentice. Hot Pie, tell Gendry what makes it a battle. It when they have got armor on. Now who told you that. A knight? How would you know he was a knight? Well, cause he got armor on. You do not have to be a knight to have armor. Any idiot can buy armor. How would you know? 'Cause I sold armor. What do the gold cloaks want with you? No idea. You are a liar. You should not insult people that are bigger than you. Then I would not get to insult anyone. No good ever come of their questions. No good ever come? Who asked questions before? How can someone so small be such a huge pain in my ass? Who asked questions? The Hand of the King. Er, hands of the King. Lord Arryn came first, a few weeks before he died. And then Lord Stark came, a few weeks before he died. Lord Stark. See? Asking me questions is bad luck. You will probably be dead soon. What did they ask about? My mom. Who your mom? Just my mom. Worked in a tavern. Died when I was little. And who was your father? He could be one of those gold-hatted bastards, for all I know. What about you, anyway? You thought they were after you, why? Did you kill someone, or is it just because you are a girl? I am not a girl!. Yes you are. You think I am as stupid as the rest of them? Stupider. Night Watch does not take girls, everyone knows that. That true. You are still a girl. I am not! Well, pull your cock out and take a piss then. I do not need to take a piss... Lommy and Hot Pie ca not know. No one can know. They will not. Not from me. My name not Arry. It Arya. Of House Stark. Yoren is taking me home to Winterfell. He was your father. The Hand. The traitor. He was never a traitor! Joffrey is a liar. So you are a highborn, then. You are a lady. No. I mean yes. My mother was a lady, and my sister - You were a lord daughter and you lived in a castle. Look, all that about cocks. I should never have said that. I have been pissing in front of you and everything. I should be calling you milady. Do not call me milady. As milady commands. Well, that was unladylike.

Scene_Texts: What you carrying? Pears and oranges. Wine from the Arbor. And the heir to Pyke of the Iron Islands. The only living son of Balon Greyjoy. Me. Do not like wine. Woman drink. I need to get to Pyke. I will find you a horse. I am heading that way. I can take you there. I bet you can. You been at sea long? Or were there just no women where you came from? None like you. You do not know what I am like. You do not know what you are like. You need someone to teach you. Know who I am? You think I offer free rides to every man in jewelry. Lord Greyjoy. Have my things sent up to the castle. You should give me the reins, I am a better rider than you. I have been on horseback for the last nine years. Nine years. Do you still know your way around a ship? Have these hands ever touched a rope? Do not you worry about my hands. The sea in my blood. You will never be in the sea if I do not watch where I am going. I have a proposal for my father. One that will make him king again. And me after him. You may stay at the castle tonight, if you are lucky. Is that an offer from my future king? An order, from your future king. You can tell your grandchildren about this night. I do not imagine it will be a story fit for children.

Specific_Stories: Theon Greyjoy-Robb ally with Balon
Scene_Texts: Father. Nine years, is it? They took a frightened boy. What have they given back? A man. Your blood and your heir. We shall see. Stark had you longer than I did. Lord Stark is gone. And how do you feel about that? What done is done. I have brought you a proposal from Robb Stark. Who gave you those clothes?. Was it Ned Stark pleasure to make you his daughter? If my clothes offend you, I will change them. It will. That bauble around your neck. Did you pay the iron price for it or the gold?. I asked a question. Did you pull it from the neck of a corpse you made or did you buy it to match your fine clothes? Iron or gold? Gold. I will not have my son dressed as a whore. My fears have come true. The Starks have made you theirs. My blood is salt and iron. Yet,, the Stark boy sends you to me like a trained raven, clutching his message. The offer he makes, is one I proposed. He heeds your counsel? I have lived with him, hunted with him, fought at his side, he thinks of me as a brother. No, not here,, not in my hearing, you will not name him brother. This son of the man who put your true brothers to the sword. Or have you forgotten your own blood? I forget nothing. I remember my brothers. And I remember when my father was a king. I see. I destroy Robb Stark enemies for him and he will make me King of the Iron Islands once again. I will lead the attack myself. Oh, you will? I am your son. Your only living heir. Who else? I told you to wait outside. How did you get past the guards? Anything with a cock is easy to fool. My dear. Yara? So good to see you, brother. This is a homecoming I will tell my grandchildren about. She ca not lead an attack! And why not? You are a woman! You are the one in skirts. This is not Winterfell, boy. Your sister took over command of your eldest brother ship after your new father killed him. What dead may never die. No man gives me a crown. I pay the iron price. I will take my crown. That is who I am. That is who we have always been. You will not stand a chance against the Lannisters on your own. Who said anything about the Lannisters?

Scene_Tiitles: Davos Seaworth's Journey,Stannis Baratheon's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Stannis Baratheon- Stannis claim to the throne-Stannis wants ships
Scene_Texts: You will have your gold when we take the treasury at King Landing. All these kings fighting for the throne, and this Stannis has the smallest army. Why would I bet on the man with the worst chance? Because you are a smart gambler. Stannis has proved himself in war. Twice. His baby brother has never set foot on a battlefield. Neither has the false king, Joffrey. And yet, they both have larger armies. Stannis has just begun the fight. His bannermen will rally to his cause. There no man in the Seven Kingdoms more honorable than Stannis Baratheon. Or more worthy of loyalty. What is the world coming to when smugglers must vouch for the honor of kings. Mind your words, pirate. Matthos. You think I am insulted? I am a pirate. I am an excellent pirate. I do not sail for promises. Of course you do. Every time you leave harbor, you are leaving on a promise. A promise that somewhere on the seas, somebody got some gold and you can take it from them. That a promise that always comes true. As is mine. You are not the young man, Salladhor. And correct me if I am wrong Only the clever ones. You want to spend your last few years on the sea, stealing from Pentoshi cheesemongers and Midanese silk merchants, then go. They are out there waiting for you. That easy. What I am offering you is hard. Come with me and plunder the greatest city in Westeros. You will be the richest man in Lysene. And the most famous. They will be singing songs about you as long as men have voices to sing. Salladhor Saan is a good name for songs. It is. One thing, I want the queen. The queen? Cersei, I want her. I will sail with your fleet, all 30 of my ships, and if we do not drown at the bottom of Blackwater Bay, I will fuck this blonde queen and I will fuck her well. This war is not about you. We are not attacking King Landing so that you can rape the queen. I am not going to rape her, I am going to fuck her. As if she would just let you! You do not know how persuasive I am. I never tried to fuck you. Stannis is the rightful king, and the Lord of Light. The one true god. I have been all over the world, my boy, and everywhere I go, people tell me about the true god. They all think they found the right one. The one true god is what between a woman legs, and better yet a queen legs. I never thought you would have a true believer for a son. He young yet. I promise you the gold. I promise you the glory. I cannot promise you the queen. You believe your king can win? He is the one true king. You Westerosee are funny people. A man chops off your fingers and you fall in love with him. I will sail with you, Davos Seaworth. You are the most honest smuggler I ever met. Make me rich. Get me to the gates of King Landing and I will. When will the King have a sail? As soon as his God wills it. He my God too, and yours. But you were too blind to see. Let me teach you how to read. Oh you and your mother. It will not take long. You already know the letters. The holy books are much more persuasive than I can be. I wish I had a God, truly! I am not mocking you, but I have seen men pray to every God there is. Pray for wind, pray for rain, pray for home. None of it works! But you always came home. I was not praying. But I was. Every night that you were at sea, I lit a candle and I prayed, for you. You want me to have a god, fine. King Stannis is my god. He raised me up and blessed me with his trust. He gave you a future I could never have imagined. You know how to read, you will be a knight someday. You think your fire god commanded all that? It was Stannis. Only Stannis. Stannis is my king, but he only a man. Do not tell him that.

Specific_Stories: Tyrion Lannister-Tyrion as hand of the king
Scene_Texts: Lord Janos Slynt was of the City Watch. You had no right to exile him. I have every right. I am the King Hand. You are serving as the King Hand until father gets here. I am Queen Regent. Listen to me, Queen Regent, you are losing the people. Do you hear me? Ha, the people. You think I care? You might find it difficult to rule over millions who want you dead. Half the city will starve when winter comes. The other half will plot to overthrow you. And your gold-plated thugs just gave them the rallying cry, " The Queen slaughters babies. ". You do not even have the decency to deny it. It was not you who gave the order, was it? Joffrey did not even tell you. Or did he tell you? I imagine that would be even worse. He did what needed to be done. You want to be the Hand of the King? You want to rule? This is what ruling is! Lying on a bed of weeds, ripping them out by the root one by one before they strangle you in your sleep. I am no king, but I think there more to ruling that that. I do not care what you think! You have never taken it seriously. You have not, Jaime has not. It all fallen on me. As has Jaime repeatedly, according to Stannis Baratheon. You are funny. You have always been funny. But none of your jokes will ever match the first one, will they? You remember... back when you ripped my mother open on your way out of her and she bled to death. She was my mother too. Now they are gone, for the sake of you. There no bigger joke in the world than that.

Scene_Texts: Your Grace. Your Grace. How did it fare with your pirate? Salladhor Saan will join our fleet. 30 ships. His men know how to fight. In my experience, pirates prefer fighting unarmed men. Does seem the wiser choice. It will not be a choice this time. Do you trust him? Salladhor Saan is an old friend, I have known him 30 years. I have never trusted him. Well if he does his job, he will have his share. Leave us. At once, Your Grace. The Lord of Light shines through you, young warrior. Come. What did you say to him? I told him death by fire is the purest death. Why? Because it is true. You are troubled my king. Yeah. These armies are but toys for the Lord of Light. Tell your lord to burn them then. I tell him nothing! I pray for his commands and I obey. My little brother has a hundred thousand men according to the scouts. Men whose allegiance rightly belongs to me. You must have faith. Faith? In a real war, the side with the greater number wins nine times out of ten. Then we must be the ten. I cannot defeat my brother in the field, and I ca not take King Landing without the men he stole. I have seen the path to victory in the flames. At first, you must give yourself to the Lord of Light. I have said the words, damn you! I burnt the idols. You must give... all of yourself. I have a wife. I took a vow. She sick. Weak. Shut away in the tower. And she disgusts you. And she given you nothing.

Scene_Tiitles: Bran Stark's Journey-Bran Stark Dreams
Specific_Stories: Bran Stark- Bran dreams
Scene_Texts: Hodor Hodor. Rouse Bran, will you? It time for his lessons. Every night it the same. I am walking and running, but I am not I am not me. I am running through the godswood, sniffing the dirt, tasting blood in my mouth when I have made a fresh kill, howling. Old Nan used to tell me stories about magical people who could live inside stags, birds, wolves. That exactly what they are, Bran, - stories. So she was lying? They do not exist? Well, they may have done. But they are gone from the world, along with much else. These are dreams, Bran, nothing more. No, my dreams are different. Mine are true. I dreamt of my father And Rickon had the same dream. What about all the dreams you had that did not come true? Hmm? Right. This link is made of Valyrian steel. Only one maester in 100 wears it on his chain. It signifies that I have studied the higher mysteries. And all who study these mysteries try their hand at spells. I was no different. I was young. And what boy does not secretly wish for hidden powers to lift him out of his dull life into a special one? But in the end, for all my efforts, I got no more out of it than a thousand boys before me. Scene_Texts: What are you doing here? I live here. Are you angry with me, brother You lying bitch. It not my fault you did not recognize me. Recognize you? How could I? The last time I saw you you looked like a fat little boy. You were a fat little boy, too, but I recognized you. Why did not you tell me? I wanted to see who you were first. And I did. The plans are made. It time you heard them. Father. Father. The wolf pup While he tangling with the lion in the Westerlands, the North is ripe for the taking. The ironborn will reave and pillage, as it was in the old days, all along the northern coast. We will spread our dominion across the green lands, securing the Neck and everything above. Every stronghold will yield to us, one by one. Winterfell may defy us for a year, but what of it? The rest shall be ours, forest, field, and hall. Yara, my daughter, you will take 30 longships to attack Deepwood Motte. I have always wanted a castle. And what my role in all this? You will take a ship to raid the fishing villages on the Stoney Shore. A ship? You give her 30 and I get one? The Sea Bitch. We thought she would be perfect for you. I am to fight fishermen? Be careful of their nets. Father I know his men. He will not give up the North so easily. They will not even know we are there - until it too late. What do you know of it, woman? I am a proven warrior. Your brothers were warriors, both of them dead at the hands of those you seem so eager to protect. I am not protecting anyone. I just wonder if it not wiser to wait. Why risk going against the North if they would be our allies? Rise up against them and they could destroy us. But if we pledge fealty to them, they will give us Casterly Rock. What are our words? Our words? We do not sow. We do not sow. We are ironborn. We are not subjects. We are not slaves. We do not plow the fields or toil in the mine. We take what is ours. Your time with the wolves has made you weak. You act as if I volunteered to go. You gave me away, if you remember. The day you bent the knee to Robert Baratheon. After he crushed you. Did you take what was yours then? You gave me away! Your boy! Your last boy! You gave me away like I was some dog you did not want anymore. And now you curse me because I have come home. You would have our father bow down to your other family? I have no other family. Do not you? Make your choice, Theon, and do it quickly. Our ships sail with or without you.

Scene_Texts: You are here to for your brother latest treasons. Your Grace, whatever my traitor brother has done, I had no part. You know that. I beg you, please Ser Lancel, tell her of this outrage. Using some vile sorcery, your brother fell on Stafford Lannister with an army of wolves. Thousands of good men were butchered. After the slaughter, the Northmen feasted on the flesh of the slain. Killing you would send your brother a message. (Cries.) But my mother insists on keeping you alive. Stand. So we will have to send your brother a message some other way. Meryn. Leave her face. I like her pretty. Meryn, my lady is overdressed. Unburden her. If you want Robb Stark to hear us, we are going to have to speak louder. What is the meaning of this? What kind of knight beats a helpless girl? The kind who serves his king, Imp. Careful, now. We do not want to get blood all over your pretty white cloak. Someone get the girl something to cover herself with. She is to be your queen. Have you no regard for her honor? I am punishing her. For what crimes? She did not fight her brother battle, you half-wit. You ca not talk to me like that. The king can do as he likes! The Mad King did as he liked. Has your Uncle Jaime ever told you what happened to him? No one threatens His Grace in the presence of the Kingsguard. I am not threatening the king, ser. I am educating my nephew. Bronn, the next time Ser Meryn speaks, kill him. That was a threat. See the difference? I apologize for my nephew behavior. Tell me the truth. Do you want an end to this engagement? I am loyal to King Joffrey, my one true love. Lady Stark, you may survive us yet. The little king backed up. Clogged from balls to brains. You think dipping his wick will cure what ails him? There no cure for being a cunt. But the boy at that age. And he got nothing to do all day but pick wings off flies. Could not hurt to get some of the poison out.

My nameday has passed. We will not tell if you will not. No. Her. Touch her. Could you hit her? My uncle sent you? Yes, Your Grace. He chose us himself. Hmm. Use this. Harder. I said harder. He would want me to get his money worth. Your Grace, too much pain will spoil the pleasure. Please, Your Grace. Your Grace, if your uncle finds out Oh, I want him to find out. You will bring her to his chambers when you are finished and show him what you have done, or the same thing will happen to you. Begin. Harder!

Scene_Tiitles: Renly Baratheon's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Renly Baratheon-Renly as a king
Scene_Texts: Well, if it is not my favorite whore monger. Pray I have not kept you waiting long. Your Grace. Now you do the Lannisters' bidding, is that it? Tell me, was my brother body even cold before you secured your newest patron? I am a practical man. Just not a loyal one. And who would you have me be loyal to? Your brother corpse? I do not like you, Lord Baelish. I do not like your face. I do not like the words that come oozing out of your mouth. I do not want you in my tent one minute more than necessary. So tell me, why are you here? You can trust Brienne. Her loyalty comes without charge. You still have many friends at court, Your Grace, many who believe Ned Stark erred by not supporting your claim. Now I understand. You know I have the numbers. You know I am marching on King Landing. When I take the throne, you hope to retain your position. And your head. I would give priority to my head. (snorts) I understand that you do not like me, and while that saddens me greatly, I did not come here today seeking your affection. When you march on King Landing, you may find yourself facing a protracted siege or open gates.

Scene_Tiitles: Petry Baelish's Journey
Specific_Stories: Margery Tyrell- Margery as a queen
Scene_Texts: Your Grace. Lord Baelish. All of these tents look the same to me. -Would you be so kind It would be my pleasure. It took me weeks to learn my way around the camp. Twice I walked in on officers in stages of undress. And the moment I learn which tent is mine, we are on the move again. " Your tent "? Not " Our tent "? The king snores, perhaps? Or simply prefers solitude? Pressures of command, no doubt. Four kings vying for the throne. I am not tutored in warfare, but basic arithmetic favors the side with the greater numbers. If war were arithmetic, the mathematicians would rule the world. I did notice your brother entering His Grace tent just now. The place of a Kingsguard is by the king side. And on the night of your wedding, who was by the king side then? You seem quite interested in our marriage. Your marriage is quite interesting. Not only to me, but to the realm. The marriage of a wealthy girl always breeds interest, if nothing else. You have never married, have you? I have been unlucky in my affections, sadly. That is sad. Though perhaps it for the best. The whole notion of marriage seems to confuse you, so allow me to explain. My husband is my king, and my king is my husband. Here is your tent, Lord Baelish. Good night.

(Valerian) Will they let us in? (Valerian) They said they would be honored to receive the Mother of Dragons. What do you know of this place? Only that the desert around their walls is called the Garden of Bones. Every time the Qartheen shut their gates on a traveler, the garden grows.

Scene_Texts: How dare you? You may have heard false reports. You betrayed Ned. Betrayed? I wanted him to serve as Protector of the Realm. I begged him to seize the moment. I trusted you. My husband trusted you. And you repaid our faith with treachery. No, my lady. Get out! Cat, I have I have loved you since I was a boy. It seems to me that fate has given us this chance Have you lost your mind? Get out! Do you want to see your girls again? Sansa, more beautiful than ever? And Arya, just as wild as ever? You have Arya, too? Both girls are healthy and safe. For now. But you know the Queen and you know Joffrey. I fear for their longevity if they remain in the capital. What do you want? The Lannisters will trade your daughters for the Kingslayer. Of course they will. Jaime Lannister for two girls? Robb will never agree to those terms. I am not bringing these terms to him. I am bringing them to you. You think I keep secrets from my son? Robb has surprised them all with his skills in battle, but he not a mother. Consider it, Cat. You may not get another chance. I have brought you a gift. I do not want your gifts. A token of Tyrion Lannister goodwill. He wants you to understand that this exchange of prisoners is offered in good faith. Good faith? What this? Your husband was an honorable man. He should rest beside his family in the crypts beneath Winterfell. You may not believe Get out.

Scene_Tiitles: Renly Baratheon's claim to the throne,Catelyn Stark's Journey,Stannis Baratheon's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Stannis Baratheon- Stannis claim to the throne,Renly Baratheon-Renly claim to the throne
Scene_Texts: Lady Stark, I had not thought to find you in the Stormlands. I had not thought to be here, Lord Stannis. Can that truly be you? Who else might it be? When I saw your standard, I could not be sure. Whose banner is that? My own. I suppose if we used the same one, the battle would be terribly confusing. Why is your stag on fire? The king has taken for his sigil the fiery heart of the Lord of Light. Ah, you must be this fire priestess we hear so much about. Mmm, brother, now I understand why you found religion in your old age. Watch yourself, Renly. No, no, I am relieved. I never really believed you were a fanatic. Charmless, rigid, a bore, yes, but not a godly man. You should kneel before your brother. He the Lord chosen, born amidst salt and smoke. Born amidst salt and smoke? - Is he a ham? That twice I have warned you. Listen to yourselves. If you were sons of mine, I would knock your heads together and lock you in a bedchamber until you remembered that you were brothers. It is strange to find you beside my brother, Lady Stark. Your husband was a supporter of my claim. Lord Eddard integrity cost him his head. And you sit beside this pretender and chastise me. We share a common enemy. The Iron Throne is mine by right. All those that deny that are my foes. The whole realm denies it, from Dorne to the Wall. Old men deny it with their death rattle and unborn children deny it in their mother wombs. No one wants you for their king. You never wanted any friends, brother. But a man without friends is a man without power. For the sake of the mother who bore us, I will give you this one night to reconsider. Strike your banners, come to me before dawn, and I will grant you your old seat in the Council. I will even name you my heir until a son is born to me. Otherwise I shall destroy you. Look across those fields, brother. Can you see all those banners? You think a few bolts of cloth will make you king? No. The men holding those bolts of cloth will make me king. We shall see, Renly. Come the dawn, we shall see. Look to your sins, Lord Renly. The night is dark and full of terrors. Would you believe I loved him once?
Scene_Keybords: banner born brother salt bolt come cloth deni

Scene_Tiitles: Daenerys Targaryen's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Daenerys Targaryen- Daenerys at Qarth
Scene_Texts: I thought we were welcome. If you heard a Dothraki horde was approaching your city, you might do the same, Khaleesi. Horde? My name is Daenerys Daenerys Stormborn of the house Targaryen. You know me, my lord? Only by reputation, Khaleesi. And I am no lord, merely a humble merchant. They call you the Mother of Dragons. And what should I call you? Oh, my name is quite long and quite impossible for foreigners to pronounce. I am simply a trader of spices. But we are the Thirteen, charged with the governance and protection of Qarth, the greatest city that ever was or will be. The beauty of Quarth is legendary Qarth. Might we see the dragons? My friend, we have traveled very far. We have no food, no water. Once I see my people fed, I would be honored Forgive me, Mother of Dragons, but no man alive has seen a living dragon. Some of my more skeptical friends refuse to believe your children even exist. All we ask is the chance to see for ourselves. I am not a liar. Oh, I do not think you are. But as I have never met you before, my opinion on the matter is of limited value. Where I come from, guests are treated with respect, not insulted at the gates. Then perhaps you should return to where you come from. We wish you well. What are you doing? You promised to receive me. We have received you. Here we are, and here you are. If you do not let us in, all of us will die. Which we shall deeply regret. But Qarth did not become the greatest city that ever was or will be by letting Dothraki savages through its gates. Khaleesi, please be careful. Thirteen! When my dragons are grown, we will take back what was stolen from me and destroy those who have wronged me. We will lay waste to armies and burn cities to the ground. Turn us away and we will burn you first. Ah. You are a true Targaryen. Only, as you said a moment ago, if we do not let you into the city, you will all die. And so Retreating in fear from a little girl is unbecoming of the greatest city that ever was or will be. The discussion is over, Xaro Xhoan Daxos. The Thirteen have spoken. I am one of the Thirteen, and I am still speaking. The girl threatens to burn our city to the ground and you would invite her in for a cup of wine? She is the Mother of Dragons. Do you expect her to watch her people starve without breathing fire? I believe we can allow a few Dothraki through our gates without dooming our city. After all, here I am, a savage from the Summer Isles, and Qarth still stands. Our decision is final. Very well. I invoke soumai. I will vouch for her, her people, and her dragons, in accordance with the law. Be it on your head. Welcome to Qarth, my lady.
Scene_Keybords: dragon greatest citi burn thirteen qarth

Scene_Tiitles: Tyrion Lannister's Journey-Tyrion Lannister as king's hand-spys on Cersei
Specific_Stories: Tyrion Lannister-Tyrion as hand of the king-Tyrion spy on Cersei
Scene_Texts: Your visits are too few, cousin. Her Grace, the Queen Regent, commands you to release Grand Maester Pycelle. Here your warrant. So it is. Will you take a cup with me? I find that mulled wine helps me sleep. I am here at Her Grace behest, not to drink with you, Imp. If my sister was so concerned for Pycelle, I would have thought she would come herself. I do not care what you make of it, so long as you release your prisoner immediately. And you have received these instructions directly from Cersei? As I said several times. And you have waited this long to deliver the information? When the Queen Regent gives me a command, I carry it out without delay. Cersei must have great trust in you, allowing you into her chamber during the hour of the wolf. The Queen Regent has a great many responsibilities. She often works from dusk till dawn. She must be very glad to have you helping her from dusk till dawn. Ah. Lavender oil. She always loved lavender oil, even as a girl. I am a knight! An anointed knight, yes. Tell me, did Cersei have you knighted before or after she took you into her bed? What? Nothing to say? No more warnings for me, ser? You will withdraw these filthy accusations. Have you ever given any thought to what King Joffrey will have to say when he finds out you have been bedding his mother? It not my fault! Did she take you against your will? Can you not defend yourself, knight? Your own father, Lord Tywin, when I was named the King squire, he told me to obey her in everything. Did he tell you to fuck her, too? I only meant I did as I was bid. Hated every moment of it, is that what you will have me believe? A high place in court, a knighthood, my sister legs spreading open for you at night. Oh, yes, it must have been terrible. Wait here. His Grace will want to hear this. Mercy! Mercy, my lord! I beg you. Save it for Joffrey. He loves a good grovel. My lord, it was your sister bidding, the Queen. I will leave the city at once, I swear. No, I think not. My lord? You heard me. My father told you to obey my sister. Obey her. Stay close to her side. Keep her trust. Pleasure her whenever she requires. No one ever need know, as long as you keep faith with me. I want to know what Cersei is doing, where she goes, who she sees, what they talk of, everything. And you will tell me. Yes, my lord, I will. I swear it, as you command. Oh, rise, rise. Let us drink to our understanding. Oh, you do not have a cup. Oh, well. Smile, cousin. My sister is a beautiful woman, and it all for the good of the realm. Go back and tell her that I beg her forgiveness, that I want no more conflict between us and that, henceforth, I shall do nothing without her consent. But her demands? Oh, I will give her Pycelle. You will? Yes, I will release him in the morning. Cersei can keep him as a pet, if she wants, but I will not have him on the Council. I could swear that I had not harmed a single hair on his head, but that would not, strictly speaking, be true. Stay within one table length.

Scene_Texts: Your Grace. Do your knucklebones bring you luck? Well, life been good since you hacked them off, Your Grace. And it four less fingernails to clean. Fewer. Pardon? Four fewer fingernails to clean. Never understood why you had to wear them. It reminds me of where I come from and where I am now. It reminds me of your justice. It was an honest punishment and you were good with the cleaver. You were a hero and a smuggler. A good act does not wash out the bad, nor a bad the good. A lesson I have tried to teach my son. Does he listen? To me? Gods, no. But if your red woman told him to leap from the crow nest She has a name. I trust you have not forgotten your smuggler tricks. I have lived within the law for 17 I want you to be a smuggler this time. Any shore, any night. What am I bringing ashore? The red woman. No one must know what you do and we will not speak of this again. I am true to Your Grace and always will be, but surely there are other ways, cleaner ways. Cleaner ways do not win wars.

Scene_Texts: Are you afraid, Onion Knight? Someone once told me the night is dark and full of terrors. You have carried more unpleasant cargo in your time. Are you a good man, Ser Davos Seaworth? I would say my parts are mixed, my lady, good and bad. If half an onion is black with rot, it a rotten onion. A man is good or he is evil. And which are you? Oh, good. I am a knight myself, of sorts, a champion of light and life. Well, that must be very nice for you. Do you love your wife? I do. Yet you have known other women. Do not talk about my wife. I am not. I am talking about other women. Like me, Ser Davos. You want me. You want to see what beneath this robe. And you will. Strange that this Lord of Light asks you to work in the shadows. Shadows cannot live in the dark, Ser Davos. They are servants of light, the children of fire. And the brighter the flame, the darker they are. These were not here before. They have barred the passage. They ca not bar our passage. Gods protect us. There only one god, Ser Davos, and he only protects those who serve him.

Scene_Tiitles: Stannis Baratheon's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Stannis Baratheon- Stannis claim to the throne-Stannis killed Renly
Scene_Texts: Your Grace. What is it? I am sorry about your brother I wanted to let you know that people grieve for him. Fools love a fool. I grieve for him as well, for the boy I need to speak to you - about what I saw in that cave. I thought I made it clear to you there would be no need to speak to me on this matter. Your Grace, I I have never known you to need to hear a thing twice. And I have never known you to hide from the truth. You have come to lecture me on truth? I have come to tell you that what I saw All my brother Except the Tyrells, who fled like cowards. They will not be able to resist us now. Soon I shall be sitting on the Iron Throne. Nothing is worth what this will cost you, not even the Iron I will hear no more about it. Take a company of men, secure the perimeter. When do we sail for King Landing? As soon as I have consolidated my troops. We will make short work of the Lannisters' fleet. Once Blackwater Bay is cleared, we will deliver our troops to their doorstep and take the city. And will you bring Lady Melisandre with you? That not your concern. If you take King Landing with her by your side, the victory will be hers. I never thought I would have reason to doubt your loyalty. Was I wrong? Loyal service means telling hard truths. Oh, truth again. All right, what the truth? The hard truth? She a foreigner preaching her foreign religion. Some believe she whispers orders in your ear and you obey. What do you believe? You won those bannermen from Renly. Do not lose them to her. We set out for King Landing without Lady Melisandre. And you lead the fleet into Blackwater Bay. Your Grace, I am honored, but my time on the sea was spent evading ships, not attacking them. The other lords will not be happy. Most of those lords should consider themselves lucky I do not hang them for treason. Hard truths cut both ways, Ser Davos.

Scene_Texts: Yeah, come on. You are the crew of the Sea Bitch? I am your commander. Welcome. Stop. Stop! Your captain commands you to stop! Where are we headed, Captain? The Stony Shore, to raid their villages. There will be spoils in it for you, and women, if you do your jobs well. And who decides if we have done our jobs well? I do. Your captain. I have been reaving and raping since before you left Balon balls, Captain Do not reckon I have got much use for your ideas on how to do it. Do not reckon I have got much use for a captain at all. I am thinking I can do the job of captain real well myself. All I need is a ship. You would not know where I could find myself a ship now, would you? You could do that, take the ship, head out on your own. And I will hunt you down, drag you back here in chains and hang you for a traitor. (laughs) Stop. We yield. Congratulations on your first command. Thank you. Kind of you to come see me off. Oh, I am not here for you. I was just on my way to Red Harbor. I have got 30 ships. There nowhere to put them here. Too narrow. You would better get out there. Would not want her to set sail without you. That would never happen. My crew would wait on deck for a year if I asked them to. This lot, though Enjoy the Stony Shore. Come on, I will take you out. Who are you? Dagmer, your first mate. Why are not you with the rest of them? Or did they send you to row me out and dump me halfway in the sea? That would be good for a laugh. They are not gonna respect you until you prove yourself. And how am I supposed to prove myself by pillaging piss-poor fishing villages? You are not. And yet that the task my father They are all Iron Islanders. Do they do as they are told or do they do as they like? The Stony Shore not far from Torrhen Square. The seat of the House of Tallhart, - a more impressive prize than a few fishermen daughters. What, you do not think we could take it? No, we could. We could never hold it for more than a few days. As soon as Winterfell got word that we would taken Torrhen Square, the Starks would send their men to take it back. And then Take me to my ship.

Scene_Texts: The Starks have overextended their lines. Now that summer over, they will have a hard time keeping their men and horses fed. The Starks understand winter better than we ever will. The cold will not beat them. Our spies report growing discontent among the Northern lords. They want to return home and gather the harvest before the crops turn. And I am sure if those same spies snuck into our own encampments, they would report growing discontent amongst the Southern lords. This is war, no one content. We have underestimated the Stark boy He has a good mind for warfare, his men worship him. And as long as he keeps winning battles, they will keep believing he is King You have been waiting for him to fail. He is not going to fail, not without our help. So how do we stop him? We have worked through the night, my lord. Perhaps we would profit from some sleep. Yes, I think you would, Reginald. And because you are my cousin Go, I am sure your wife must miss you. My wife in Lannisport. Well, then you would better start riding. Go, before I change my mind and send her your head. If your name was not Lannister, you would be scrubbing out pots in the cook tent. Go! Not wine, water. We will be here for some time. Girl Where are you from? Maidenpool, my lord. And who are the Lords of Maidenpool? Remind me. House Mooton, my lord. And what is their sigil? A red salmon. I think a Maidenpool girl You are a Northerner, are not you? (nods.) Good. One more time, where are you from? Barrowton, my lord. House Dustin. Two crossed longaxes beneath a black crown. And what do they say of Robb Stark in the North? They call him the Young Wolf. And? They say he rides into battle on the back of a giant direwolf. They say he can turn into a wolf himself when he wants. They say he ca not be killed. And do you believe them? No, my lord. Anyone can be killed. Fetch that water.

Scene_Texts: He is not here yet. He would have seen us, blown the horn. When will he come? The Halfhand does things in his own time. My uncle Most of them are true. So it is possible for someone to survive out here on their own. Well, possible for the Halfhand. Beautiful, is not it? Gilly would love it here. There nothing more sickening than a man in love. About time you did something. At least you will keep warm. The Fist of the First Men. Think of how old this place is. Before the Targaryens defeated the Andals, before the Andals took Westeros from the First Men. Before I die, please, stop talking. Thousands and thousands of years ago, the First Men stood here where we are standing all through the long night. What do you think they were like, the First Men? Stupid. Smart people do not find themselves in places like this. (laughs) I think they were afraid. I think they came here to get away from something. And I do not think it worked. Wildlings? One blast is for rangers returning. Wildlings is two blasts. So you got to stand there waiting, wondering. One blast for friends, two for foes. And three for The White Walkers. It been a thousand years, but that the only time they blow the horn three times. But if it been a thousand years, how do you know? Well I read it in a book. Scene_Texts: Take care, my lord. I remember reading an old sailors' proverb, " Piss on wildfire and your cock burns off. " Oh, I have not conducted this experiment. It could well be true. After the dragons died, wildfire was the key to the Targaryen power. (scoffs) My companion If I could tell you how many crazy old men I have seen pushing carts around army camps making grand claims about jars full of pig shit. No offense meant. Our order does not deal in pig shit. The substance is fire given form. And we have been perfecting it since the days of Maegor. To do what? The jars are put in catapults and flung at the enemy. How much do you have? If you could get real soldiers to man the catapults, then maybe you would hit your target one time in ten, but all the real soldiers are in the Riverlands with your father My lord, this man is insulting. I do not know if you have ever seen a battle, old man, but things can get a bit messy. 'Cause when we are flinging things at Stannis, he flinging them right back at us. Men die, men shit themselves, men run, which means pots falling, which means fire inside the walls, which means the poor cunts trying to defend the city end up burning it down. My friend He would not dare insult my order whilst Aerys Targaryen lived. Well, he not living anymore. And all his pots of wildfire did not help him, did they? Men win wars, not magic tricks. We have been working tirelessly, day and night, ever since your royal sister Our present count stands at 7,811. Enough to burn Stannis Baratheon fleet and armies both. This is a shit idea. Scene_Texts: It looked like Stannis. To me it just looked like... A shadow in the shape of a man. In the shape of Stannis. We should reach my son Will you stay there long, my lady? Only long enough to tell Robb what I have seen. After that, I will leave for Winterfell. My two youngest need me. I have been away from them for far too long. I never knew my mother. I am sorry. My own mother died on the birthing bed when I was very young. It a bloody business. What comes after is even harder. Once you are safely back amongst your own people, will you give me leave to go, my lady? You mean to kill Stannis. I swore a vow. But Stannis has a great army around him. His own guards are sworn to keep him safe. I am as good as any of them. I should never have fled. Renly death was no fault of yours. You served him bravely. I only held him that once as he was dying. He gone, Brienne. You serve nothing and no one by following him into the earth. Renly enemies are Robb enemies as well. I do not know your son But I could serve you, if you would have me. You have courage. Not battle courage, perhaps, but, I do not know, a woman kind of courage. And I think that when the time comes, you will not hold me back. Promise me that you will not hold me back from Stannis. When the time comes, I will not hold you back. Then I am yours, my lady. I will shield your back and give my life for yours, if it comes to that. I swear it by the Old Gods and the new. I vow that you shall always have a place in my home and at my table and that I shall ask no service of you that might bring you dishonor. I swear it by the Old Gods and the new.

And we ca not wait for them here with nothing but a pile of stones to protect us. You saying we should fall back to the Wall? Mance was one of us once. Now he one of them. He going to teach them our way of doing things. They will hit us in force and they will not run away when we hit back. They are gonna be more organized than before, more disciplined, more like us. Scene_Tiitles: Daenerys Targaryen's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Daenerys Targaryen- Daenerys at Qarth
Scene_Texts: So, tell me, how long has your manservant He not my manservant and he not in love with me. He my advisor Unlikely. I can almost always tell what a man wants. And what about what a woman wants? Much more complicated. You, for example, what do you want? To cross the Narrow Sea and take back the Iron Throne. Why? Because I promised my khalasar I would protect them and find them a safe home. You want to conquer the Seven Kingdoms for the Dothraki? I want them because they are mine by right. The Iron Throne is mine and I will take it. Ah, a conqueror. And how did you get all of this? Did someone give it to you? No. I come from nothing. I hit the docks like a piece of cargo, except someone normally cares what happens to cargo. So you wanted more than you had and you took it. You are a conqueror, too. You are just less ambitious. (chuckles) What do you want, Xaro Xhoan Daxos? At the gates of the city, you bled for me. Why? I will show you why. The door and the vault is made of Valyrian stone. The hardest steel does not make a mark. I offered the greatest locksmiths in Qarth their weight in gold if they could break into it. I made the same offer to the greatest thieves. They all went home empty-handed. The only thing that can open this door is this key. And behind the door? (chuckles) And it can all be mine? All? Let us say half. More than enough to buy horses, ships, armies. Enough to go home. All I have to do? Is marry me. That was a romantic proposal. I have already married once for love, but the gods stole her from me. I come from nothing. My mother and father never owned a pair of shoes. But marry me, and I will give you the Seven Kingdoms and our children will be princes and princesses. See? I have more ambition than you thought. The time is right, Daenerys Targaryen, First of Your Name. Robert Baratheon is dead. If you cross the sea with an army you bought The Seven Kingdoms are at war with one another. Four false kings destroying the country. To win Westeros, you need support from Westeros. The usurper is dead. (laughs) The Starks fight the Lannisters, and Baratheons fight each other. According to your new friend who earned your trust by cutting his hand? The time to strike is now. We need to find ships and an army or we will spend the rest of our lives rotting away at the edge of the world. Rich men do not become rich by giving more than they get. They will give you ships and soldiers and they will own you forever. Moving carefully is the hard way, but it the right way. And if I would listened to that advice outside the gates of Qarth, we would all be dead by now. I know the opportunity before you seems like the last you will ever have, - but you must Do not speak to me like I am a child. I only want What do you want? Tell me. To see you on the Iron Throne. Why? You have a good claim. A title. A birthright. But you have something more than that. You may cover it up and deny it, but you have a gentle heart. You would not only be respected and feared, you would be loved. Someone who can rule and should rule. Centuries come and go without a person like that coming into the world. There are times when I look at you and I still ca not believe you are real. So what would you have me do, as my advisor Make your own way. Find your own ship. You only need one. The allies we need are in Westeros, not Qarth. And how do I get the ship? I will find it for you. A sound ship with a good captain. I look forward to meeting him. Khaleesi.

Specific_Stories: Theon Greyjoy-Theon invade winterfell-Theon forces bran
Scene_Texts: I have taken your castle. Theon? It Prince Theon now. Get up. You have to get dressed. I have taken Winterfell. I took it. I am occupying it. I sent men over the walls with grappling claws and ropes. Why? To take the castle. You went with Robb. And he sent me back to Pyke. I am a Greyjoy. I ca not fight for Robb and my father both. Where Hodor? I do not know. Find the halfwit. (nods) My men are bringing your people together in the courtyard. Why? So you and I can go down and tell them - how you have yielded Winterfell to me. I will not. Yes, you will. I will not. I will never yield. We will fight you and throw you out. The castle is mine. But these people are still yours. You will yield to keep them safe, to keep them alive. That what a good lord would do. Think carefully about what you want to say. Theon. Did you hate us the whole time?

Scene_Tiitles: Theon Greyjoy's journey, Bran Stark's Journey
Specific_Stories: Theon Greyjoy-Theon invade winterfell
Scene_Texts: I have yielded Winterfell to Theon.. Louder. Say Prince Theon. I have yielded Winterfell to Prince Theon. You all know me. Aye, we know you for a steaming sack of shit. Farlen, you be silent. Listen to your little lord, Farlen. He has more sense than you do. All of you should do as he commands. My father He claims the North as well by right of conquest. - You are all his subjects. Bugger that. I serve the Starks. If you think you can hold the North with it Shut up! If you serve me as loyally as you served Ned Stark, I will be as good to you as he ever was. Betray me, and you will wish you had not. Maester Luwin, send a raven to Pyke informing my father And one to Deepwood Motte to my sister Inform her that she to bring You are a maester I am. I am the Lord Send the ravens. My lord. My Lord Greyjoy. I see you have finally learned how to address your betters. What do you want? I was brought here a captive. You were here the day I was taken. I am the one who took you. What of it? Let me serve you. Serve me how? I need fighters, not kitchen sluts. It was Robb Stark who put me in the kitchens. Put a spear in my hand again. So you can bury it in my neck? Do you take me for a fool? Get up. Step aside. Why? It your dream, little lord. The ocean has come to swallow this place. I ai not letting it drown me. You will all go about your tasks as usual. And in a few days' time-- Greyjoy! We caught this one on his way back from Torrhen Square. Took out two of ours before I got his sword. Ser Rodrik, it grieves me that we meet as foes. It grieves me you have less honor than a back alley whore. You were raised here under this roof. These people are your people. They are not my people. King Robb thought of you as a brother. My brothers are dead. They died fighting Stark men, men like you. Aye, they died fighting a war your father started. Lord Stark raised you among his own sons. Among them, but not one of them. I was his hostage, taken from my home. If he were alive to see this He not. He dead. The Seven Kingdoms are at war. And Winterfell is mine. I should have put a sword in your belly instead of in your hand. You have served this house faithfully, old man. But keep talking and I will-- Take him to the cells. Lock him up My prince. You cannot let that stand. He must pay. I will lock him in a cell until he rots. No, he has to pay the iron price. They will never respect you while he lives. Ser Rodrik, I sentence you to death! No! You said no harm would come to them if I yielded. The old man could not keep his mouth shut. I urge you not to make a hasty decision. He disrespected me in front of my men. That was his decision, not mine. He is worth more to you alive than dead. The Starks will pay. Please, Theon, think what you do. You will address me as Prince Theon or you will be next. Come. No! No! Theon! (to THEON) Please Ser Rodrik! He who passes the sentence should swing the sword. I am begging you. Coward. Stop. Stop! Stop right now! You do not give commands anymore, little lord. Please, stop this. Please stop him. Hush now, child I am off to see your father You said no harm would come! You said no harm would come. Theon, please. Any last words, old man? Gods help you, Theon Greyjoy. Now you are truly lost. Theon, please do not. Do something! I will do anything, please! No, please stop it!
Scene_Keybords: prince harm please said ser stop theon

Specific_Stories: Jon Snow -Jon as night's watch, The Dire Wolf
Scene_Texts: Ghost, stay with us. Ghost! There goes your pet. He not a pet. No, you are right, he not. You ca not tame a wild thing. You ca not trust a wild thing. Ghost is different. So you think. Wild creatures have their own rules, their own reasons. And you will never know them. Now the wildlings we are looking for sleep during the day and hunt at night. I thought you said you could not know wild things. I said you ca not. They find a nice cave to hide in while the sun up and do their killing when it dark. We could do the same. No, we could not. This is their country. They know where to walk, where not to walk. I have lost good men who fell into a crevasse they did not see till they were in it. My father (laughs) I was not joking. Look around, boy This look like home to you? You start thinking you know this place, it will kill you. You understand me? (nods) No, you do not. We are at war. We have always been at war. It never going to end couldause we are not fighting an enemy. We are fighting the North, and it not going anywhere. The Watch has given you a great gift. You only have one thing to give in return, your life. I will gladly give my life. I do not want you to be glad about it. I want you to curse and fight until your heart done pumping. And know this, boy Your death will be a gift for them south of the Wall. They will never know what you have done. They will never know how you died. They will not even know your damn name. But they will be alive because some nameless bastard Now, do you understand me? I do. You are even dumber than you look. It just words, boy Make us feel like we have got a purpose. Come on. We have got to find these goat fuckers before night falls and they find us.

Scene_Tiitles: Tywin Lannister's Journey-Tywin Lannister and his army,Petry Baelish's Journey
Specific_Stories: Tywin Lannister-Robb against Lannisters,Arya Stark-Arya as Lannister cupbearer
Scene_Texts: Can you read? My lord? Can you read? This letter detailing our infantry movements was meant for Lord Damon of House Marbrand. It was sent to Lord Marlyn of House Dormand. My apologies, my lord. I must have Girl It the one on this My cupbearer can read better than you. To whom does House Dormand owe allegiance? My lord, I To the Starks of Winterfell! Who have 20,000 men and my son! I judged you might be good for something more than brutalizing peasants. I see I overestimated you. If you ever put my son life at risk again, I will Leave us. Put the book away, girl Maybe you should devise our next battle plan while you are about it. Lord Petry Baelish. Mmm. Give us the room. (to Arya) Clear all this. Lord Tywin. (not amused) Baelish. Wine? Thank you. What news from the capital? I traveled here directly from Renly Baratheon camp. Ah, the late King Renly. Rather a short reign. Murdered by a woman, I hear. So they say. There has been talk of other forces at work. Dark forces. Here. Men love to blame demons when their grand plans unravel. It is my belief that a moment of chaos affords opportunities lost soon after. You say that as if you were the first man alive to think it. Yes, a crisis is an opportunity. What other brilliant insights have you brought me today? After the Lannisters and the Starks, the Tyrells command the largest host. Their lands are the most fertile in the Seven Kingdoms, - feeding horses and soldiers. Yes, yes, yes. The Tyrells have not yet declared for any of the surviving kings. Loras wants revenge. He blames Stannis for Renly death. And Margaery Wants to be queen Yes, she does. House Tyrell rebelled against the Iron Throne. Against my grandson They did. And perhaps that treason should be punished one day, after Stannis and Robb Stark are defeated. (to Arya) More wine for Lord Baelish. If you will allow me to represent your family interests, I believe that an advantageous agreement TYWIN The Tyrell host has returned to Highgarden? They have. Pardon, my lord. It only wine. You would ride there yourself? Tonight, with your leave. I will have an answer by nightfall. That will be all, girl And what else? On your son Tyrion directive, I met with Catelyn Stark. Why? He had an interesting proposal for her concerning her daughters. Hmm.

Specific_Stories: Jon Snow -Jon as night's watch-Jon and Ygritte-the wildings
Scene_Texts: A girl. A wildling. We could question her. You could. She will not answer. I have known a wildling to bite off his tongue instead of talking. What your name? Ygritte. She was reaching for this ax when you got to her. Give her half a chance, she will bury it in your face. I gave you my name. I am Jon Snow. You ought to burn them you killed. We would need a big fire for that. Tell me, Ygritte. Why do you want us to build a big fire? Are there some more friends in the area? Burn them or maybe you will need those swords again. Our boy He can do it again if he has to. What waits beyond the pass? The free folk. How many? Hundreds and thousands. More than you have ever seen, crow. Why come to the mountains? What in the Frostfangs your king Do you mean to march on the Wall? Do you know who I am, girl Qhorin Halfhand. Tell me true. If your people captured me, would they take me prisoner? They would take your head off your shoulders if they was feeling kind. If not, they would kill you slow. We have no food for her. Ca not spare a man to watch her. Ca not let her go. She will bring Mance Rayder army down on us. It needs to be done. Want me to do it? No. No, I will do it. Come, brothers. We will leave him to it. We will meet you at the top. Do not take too long. We are deep in their country now. You never killed a woman before, did you? You do not need to do it. Mance would take you. I know he would. There secret ways. The crows would never catch us. I am as much a crow as they are. Will you burn me? After? Ca not. Someone might see the smoke. Strike hard and true, Jon Snow, or I will come back and haunt you. That cold. Do it. Bastard, do it! You ca not do it. We both know it. The sun going down, Jon Snow. And your friends are nowhere close. I will find them. Call them. Go on. Call loudly.

You sound like a little cat mewling for his mother. Princes do not cry. I saw you cry. Did you say something, my lady? My little brother So? It seems a normal thing. Scene_Texts: Hail Joffrey! Hail to the King. Seven blessings on you, Your Grace. Murderer! Bastard! All hail the King. He no king. He a bastard! Please, Your Grace, we are hungry. Freak. Get the Prince Yes, my lord. Come, quickly. Please, Your Grace, give us some food! Bread, Your Grace, please! Who threw that? I want the man who threw that. Find who did that and bring him to me! Hold on! Hold them back! Just kill them! Kill them all! Move. Move! Pull back! Tear him to pieces! What are you doing? I want these people executed! And they want the same for you. Where Sansa? Through the door. Come on. Push hard. Protect the king! Get back! Fall back! Keep him safe! Come in! Come in! Keep him safe! Motherfucker! Brotherfucker! Watch out. Hold them back. Come on. Hey. Traitors! - I will have all their heads. You blind, bloody fool. You ca not insult me. We have had vicious kings and we have had idiot kings, but I do not know if we have ever been cursed with a vicious idiot for a king. You ca not I can, I am. They attacked me! They threw a cow pie at you, so you decided to kill them all? They are starving, you fool. All because of a war you started. You are talking to a king! And now I have struck a king. Did my hand fall from my wrist? Where is the Stark girl Let them have her. If she dies, you will never get your Uncle Jaime back. You owe him quite a bit, you know. Where are you going? You ever been fucked, little girl? Come here. Take some men and go and find the Stark girl I take my orders from the king. Where? This way. Please! No! No! Please! You are all right now, little bird. You are all right. We will get you. We will get you. This way. Are you hurt, my lady? The little bird bleeding. Someone take her back to her cage. See to that cut. Scene_Tiitles: Daenerys Targaryen's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Daenerys Targaryen- Daenerys at Qarth
Scene_Texts: He should not make me wait. The Spice King is the second wealthiest man in Qarth. He makes everyone wait. Of course, you could have avoided this embarrassment if you married the wealthiest man in Qarth. I already have a husband. Khal Drogo is gone, Khaleesi. You are far too young to be a widow forever and far too beautiful. And you are far too smart to think that I will succumb to flattery. I have traveled very far in my life and met many women, but none that are immune to flattery. The Mother of Dragons! Ah, here he comes. Forgive me. I had terrible dreams last night. Terrible dreams. I could not sleep until the sun was shining and the birds were singing. Look what a beauty you are now the Red Waste has been washed off you. I am sorry about all that unpleasantness. The silver hair of a true Targaryen. Xaro Xhoan Daxos, she is far too lovely for a glorified dockworker like yourself. Very true, and yet they say that your grandfather, who sold pepper off the back of a wagon, married a lady far lovelier and higher born than himself. Every lady alive was lovelier and higher born than my grandfather. Did my servants not offer you something to eat, to drink? I will have them flogged in the square. Thank you, my lord. You are a gracious host, but there is no servant alive that can bring me what I want. Oh, she has a talent for drama, this one. So, my little princess, what is it you want? My birthright. The Seven Kingdoms of Westeros. I fear I am no better than a servant in this regard. I cannot give you what I do not have. I am not asking you for the kingdoms. I am asking you for ships. I need to cross the Narrow Sea. I need my ships as well. I use them, you see, to bring spices from one port to another. Whatever you grant me now will be repaid three times over when I retake the Iron Throne. Retake? Did you once sit on the Iron Throne? My father But if you did not sit on it yourself, would it not be correct to say " take the Iron Throne "? I did not come here to argue grammar. Of course not. You came to take my ships. So let me explain my position, little princess Unlike you, I do not have exalted ancestors. I make my living by trade. And I judge every trade on its merits. You ask for ships. You say I shall be repaid triple. I do not doubt your honesty or your intentions. But before you repay your debts, you must seize the Seven Kingdoms. Do you have an army? Not yet. You do not have an army. Do you have powerful allies in Westeros? There are many there that support my claim. When were you there last? I left when I was a baby. So, in truth, you have no allies. The people will rise to fight for their rightful queen when I return. Ah. Forgive me, little princess Now if you will pardon me. Do you know lllyrio Mopatis, Magister of Pentos? Yes, we have met. A shrewd man. For my wedding, he gave me three petrified dragon eggs. He believed The world believed that the ages had turned them to stone. How many centuries has it been since dragons roamed the skies? But I dreamt that if I carried those eggs into a great fire, they would hatch. When I stepped into the fire, my own people thought I was mad. But when the fire burned out, I was unhurt, the Mother of Dragons. Do you understand? I am no ordinary woman. My dreams come true. I admire your passion. But in business, I trust in logic, not passion. I am sorry, little princess I am not your little princess I am Daenerys Stormborn of the blood of Old Valyria, and I will take what is mine. With fire and blood, I will take it. Yes, my lady, but not with my ships.

He reversed them in his head. The maester said he would heard tell of this affliction and that we simply must accept it. Ha! After that, I sat Jaime down for four hours every day until he learned. He hated me for it, for a time. For a long time. But he learned. Hmm. Where is your father? Is he alive? Who was he? A stonemason. A stonemason who could read? Hmm. He taught himself. Quite a man. What killed him? Loyalty. You are a sharp little thing, are not you? Did... Forgive me, my lord. I should not ask questions. No. But you have already begun. Did you know your father, my lord? I did. I grew up with him. I watched him grow old. He loved us. He was a good man, but a weak man. A weak man who nearly destroyed our house and name. I am cold. I will fetch more wood for the fire, my lord. Mmm.

Scene_Tiitles: Robb Stark as a king in the north-Robb Stark and Talisa relationship
Specific_Stories: Robb Stark-Robb as a king in the north-Robb and Talisa
Scene_Texts: Your Grace. Your Grace. My honor, Your Grace. Your Grace. Your Grace. Quent. Lady Talisa. Your Grace. I am not sure I am a lady. Westerosi customs are still a bit foreign to me. It hard to keep all the rules straight. But if I remember my lessons, a woman of noble birth is always called a lady. Unless she a queen or a princess. I could find someone who knows. Why are you so sure I am of noble birth? Because it obvious. What if I told you my father sold lace on the Long Bridge, and my mother, my brother and I lived with him above our shop? I would call you a liar. Not very noble to accuse a lady of dishonesty. I always thought I was a brilliant liar. Better at amputations, I am afraid. Quite a pretty spot. Will we be here long? I could not really discuss troop movements with you. I am not a spy. Of course, a spy would deny being a spy. You are right. You have found me out. I am writing a letter to the Lannisters. " The young wolf is on the move. " Perhaps you would join me. If you have got time, of course, for, well Robb. Mother. Mother, this is Lady Talisa. She been helping with the wounded. She been very helpful. Lady Talisa. Lady Stark. Lady Talisa Maegyr. Maegyr? Forgive me, I do not know this name. An uncommon name here. An old name in Volantis. Excuse me, my lady. Your Grace. I have missed you. Yes, you look positively forlorn. You surprised me, that all. I did not think I would see you today. I wish that you were free to follow your heart. I know. You have inherited your father responsibilities. I am afraid they come at a cost. You are promised to another. I know. A debt that must be paid. I have not forgotten. Your Grace. My lady. News from Winterfell.

I am a prince There are other ways to serve, my prince Like what? We know things, the free people. You know things? Like what? How to eat dirt? Other things. Savage things. Wait outside. Scene_Texts: The Spice King refuses me because I am a bad investment. The Silk King will not support me because of his business with the Lannisters. Why offend his best customer? And the Copper King offers me a single ship on the condition that I lie with him for a night. Does he think I will whore myself for a boat? When I came to this city, I had nothing. Truly nothing. I slept by the docks. And when I could find work loading the ships, I would eat. If not, I dreamed of food. Today, I am the richest man in Qarth. Do you think the path from poverty to wealth is always pure and honorable? I have done many things, Khaleesi, that a righteous man would condemn. And here I am, with no regrets. Where are they? Where are my dragons?

Scene_Texts: Halt! Enjoying your first hunt? So far, hunting seems very similar to riding, my lord. With hunting, there blood at the end. They are little boys. I was a little boy when I was torn away from my home and brought here. So I kept my word. I never ran away. If I find them soon enough, I will not hurt them. Well, I will hurt them, but I will not kill them. Those boys are of far more value to you alive than dead. They have no value to me missing. Robb will have sent a force to retake Winterfell by now. Robb in the Riverlands. My sister She will get here long before they do. And Ned Stark always said 500 men could hold Winterfell again 10,000. We have a scent! The hounds have the scent. Come, Maester, do not look so grim. It all just a game.

Scene_Texts: We should have took more food. We could not risk going to the kitchens. Those people all love you. They would have given you whatever you needed. And if Theon found out, he would hang them. The boy ca not survive on walnuts. I am fine. We have been walking since before sunrise. Even Hodor will tire. Hodor Hodor. Even you, sweet giant. Hodor. Wait, I know that farm. I sent those two Winterfell orphans there. Jack and Billy. They will give us some food. We ca not risk it. If Theon tracks us here, he will torture them until he finds out where we are. Billy climbs a tree better than anyone. You have never seen me climb a tree, little man. They will be after us with hounds. We got a good start on them, but we ca not outrun hounds forever.

Scene_Texts: Did you pull a knife on me in the night? What the matter? Ca not be the first time you pressed your bone against a woman arse. Let move. It is the first time. How old are you, boy? I am a man of the Night Watch. You are a boy who never been with a girl. Do not your stones start to hurt if your bone never gets Do not call them that. What, stones? Or bone? Neither. Both. Move! I heard they get all swollen and bruised if you do not use them. Of course, maybe that just what the lads say when they want me feeling sorry for them. As if I would feel sorry for them. Are there no girl crows? There are no women of the Night Watch, no. So the lads just do it with each other? No. Never? Never. We swore an oath. You have sheep at the Wall? With your hands, then? No wonder you are all so miserable. Would you please shut up? Would you please shut up? You think you are better than me, crow. - I am a free woman. You are a free woman? I might be your prisoner, but I am a free woman. If you are my prisoner, you are not a free woman. That what " prisoner " means. And you think you are free? You swore some stupid oath and now you can never touch a girl. It was my choice to say the words. So you do not like girls? Of course I like girls. But you chose never to touch them. That the price you pay if you want to be a man of the Night Watch. So instead of getting naked with a girl, you would prefer to invade our lands Invade your lands? Wildlings raid our lands all the time. Some of them tried to kill my little brother Yhey are not your lands! We have been here the whole time. You lot came along and just put up a big wall and said it was yours. My father I have the blood of the First Men. My ancestors lived here, same as yours. So why are you fighting us?

Scene_Tiitles: Tywin Lannister's Journey-Tywin Lannister and his army,Arya Stark's Journey
Specific_Stories: Arya Stark-Arya as Lannister cupbearer,Tywin Lannister-Robb against Lannisters
Scene_Texts: Go on. Now I want you to tell me what happened. Come on, this way. Come on, speak up. Speak up. Wolfsbane. A rare substance. This is no common assassin. We hanged 20 men last night. I do not care if you hanged 100. A man tried to kill me. I want his name and I want his head. We think it was an infiltrator from the Brotherhood Without Banners. Pretentious name for a band of outlaws. We ca not allow rebels behind our lines to harass us with impunity. We look like fools and they look like heroes. That how kings fall. I want them dead, every one. Killing them is not the problem. It finding them. Have you gone soft, Clegane Burn the villages, burn the farms. Let them know what it means to choose the wrong side. Mmm. Is that mutton? Yes, my lord. Do not like mutton. I will bring something else. Leave it. Are you hungry? No. Of course you are. Eat. I will eat in the kitchen later. It bad manners to refuse a lord offer. Sit. Eat. You are small for your age. I suppose you have been underfed your whole life. I eat a lot. I just do not grow. Mmm. This will be my last war. Win or lose. Have you ever lost before? Do you think I would be in my position if I had lost a war? (shakes her head) But this is the one I will be remembered for. The War of Five Kings, they are calling it. My legacy will be determined in the coming months. Do you know what legacy means? It what you pass down to your children and your children children. It what remains of you when you are gone. Harren the Black thought this castle would be his legacy. The greatest fortress ever built. Dragons? Yes. Dragons happened. Harrenhal was built to withstand an attack from the land. A million men could have marched on these walls, and a million men would have been repelled. But an attack from the air with dragon fire Mmm-mmm. Harren and all his sons roasted alive within these walls. Aegon Targaryen changed the rules. That why every child alive still knows his name Aegon and his sisters. Mmm? It was not just Aegon riding his dragon. It was Rhaenys and Visenya, too. Correct. A student of history, are you? Rhaenys rode Meraxes. Visenya rode Vhagar. I am sure I knew that when I was a boy. Visenya Targaryen was a great warrior. She had a Valyrian steel sword she called Dark Sister. Hmm. She a heroine of yours, I take it? (smiles) Are not most girls more interested in the pretty maidens from the songs? Jonquil with the flowers in her hair? Most girls are idiots. You remind me of my daughter Where did you learn all this stuff about Visenya and her Valyrian steel sword? From my father He was a well-read stonemason. Ca not say I have ever met a literate stonemason. Have you met many stonemasons, my lord? Careful now, girl I enjoy you, but be careful. Take that back to the kitchen. Eat what you want. And, girl " M'lord. " Lowborn girls say " m'lord, " not " my lord. " If you are going to pose as a commoner, you should do it properly. My mother served Lady Dustin for many years, my lord. She taught me how to speak proper Properly. You are too smart for your own good. Has anyone told you that? Yes. Go on.
