Scene_Texts: You think we are savages because we do not live in stone castles. We ca not make steel as good as yours, it true, but We are free. If someone tried to tell us we could not lie down as man and woman, we would shove a spear up his arse. We do not go serving some shit king who only king because his father was. No. No, you serve Mance Rayder, the King beyond the Wall. We chose Mance Rayder to lead us. He was a crow, same as you, but he wanted to be free. You could be free, too. You do not need to live your whole life taking commands from old men. Wake up when you want to wake up. I could show you the streams to fish, the woods to hunt. Build yourself a cabin and find a woman to lie with in the night. You are a pretty lad. The girls would claw each other eyes out to get naked with you. Walk. I could teach you how to do it. I know how to do it. You know nothing, Jon Snow.

Scene_Texts: And what did she say? She admired your spirit, Your Grace. And what then? She If every man were held accountable for the actions of every distant relative, Ser Alton, we would all hang. She tore the paper in half, Your Grace. You have acted with honor. I thank you for it. Lord Karstark, see that Ser Alton pen is clean, and give him a hot supper. Ser Alton pen is occupied, Your Grace. The prisoners from the Yellow Fork. Too many prisoners. Is there room for Ser Alton? Does he need to lie down? Have the men build him a new pen. Put him in with the Kingslayer for now. Have your boy watch over them. Torrhen. That will be all. Your Grace. A minute of your time? I have been treating your wounded men. And my enemies, as some of my bannermen are fond of mentioning. They are not my enemies. That what I tell my bannermen. I have already run through the supplies I brought with me. Some are easily replaced. Egg yolks, turpentine, oil of roses. But some are not. I need silk for stitching. I need fennel root for those with fever, willow bark. Mostly I need milk of the poppy. You saw what it was like to amputate a foot without any. I assume there will be more loss of limb before this war is over. If you need help finding these I know where to find them. I am sorry, I should not interrupt you. Continue, my lady. You are riding to the Crag to negotiate a surrender? Yes. The Crag will have a maester and he will have what I need. I expect he will. If I could write a list. Come with me to the Crag. I do not think that will be Let the maester show you his stores. I want the wounded men to be treated well, all the wounded men.

Scene_Texts: You came back. As soon as I heard. Do you know anything? Irri is dead. I know. She was a good She dead. She died alone. She died for me and I could not protect her. Doreah? We ca not find her. She must be dead, too. I led my people out of the Red Waste and into the slaughterhouse. I should have been here. You went to find me a ship. My place is by your side. I should not have left you alone with these people. " These people "? They are not to be trusted. And who is to be trusted? Who are my people? The Targaryens? I only knew one, my brother The Dothraki? Most of them turned on me the day that Khal Drogo fell from his horse. Your people are in Westeros. The people in Westeros do not know I am alive. They will soon enough. And then what? They will pray for my return? They will wave dragon banners and shout my name? That what my brother You are not your brother Trust me, Khaleesi. There it is. " Trust me. " And it you I should trust, Ser Jorah? Only you? I do not need trust any longer. I do not want it and I do not have room for it. You are too young to be so And you are too familiar. Forgive me, Khaleesi. No one can survive in this world without help. No one. Let me help you, please. Tell me how. Find my dragons.

Scene_Tiitles: Sansa Stark's Journey,Cersei Lannister as Queen
Specific_Stories: Sansa and Joffrey-Wedding between Joffrey Baratheon and Sansa Stark,Sansa Stark-Sansa and Cersei
Scene_Texts: Your mother You flowered, my dear. No more. My mother In what way? I thought it would be less Less messy. Wait until you birth a child. You are a woman now. Do you have any idea what that means? I am fit to bear children for the king A prospect that once delighted you, bringing little princes and princesses into the world, the greatest honor for a queen. (nods) Joffrey has always been difficult. Even his birth, I labored a day and a half to bring him into this world. You cannot imagine the pain. I screamed so loudly, I was sure Robert would hear me in the Kingswood. His Grace was not with you? Robert was hunting. That was his custom. Whenever my time was near, my royal husband And when he returned, he would present me with some pelts or a stag head, and I would present him with a baby. Not that I wanted him there, mind you. I had Grand Maester Pycelle, an army of midwives, and I had my brother When they told Jaime he was not allowed in the birthing room, he smiled and asked which one of them proposed to keep him out. Joffrey will show you no such devotion. You may never love the king I love His Grace with all my heart. That so very touching to hear. Permit me to share some womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. The more people you love, the weaker you are. You will do things for them that you know you should not do. You will act the fool to make them happy, to keep them safe. Love no one but your children. On that front, a mother has no choice. But should not I love Joffrey, Your Grace? You can try, little dove.
Scene_Keybords: present birth would mother joffrey love world child grace

Scene_Tiitles: Robb Stark as a king in the north,Jaime Lannister deeds
Specific_Stories: Robb Stark-Robb as a king in the north-Jaime inprisoned by Robb
Scene_Texts: Who did you say your mother was again? Cinda Lannister. Is she the fat one? Well, perhaps she gotten a little larger than she No, no. There only one fat Lannister. If she was your mother, you would know it. I squired for you once, you know. When? The tournament, the day of Willem Frey wedding. I went to Willem Frey wedding? You did. Your squire had gotten so drunk the night before that he threw up. He threw up on his horse on the way to the tourney grounds. What was his name? Bryan. Poor lad. That was my brother I remember you. You would never squired for anyone before. That right. I ran up and volunteered. " Let me, my lord. Let me. " My father was furious. Afraid I would embarrass our family in front of the Family. You did not, though. You really remember? You knew when you were needed and when to go away. It a rare talent. Most of my squires, they mean well, but young men with big jobs, they tend to overdo them. When I think back to that day Shh! You were saying? I Never mind. It embarrassing. More embarrassing than being chained to a post covered in your own shit? I remember everything about that day, your helmet, your horse, the rake lines in the dirt along the list, where the sun was in the sky when you knocked Balon I will remember it all until I die. That was the best day of my life. And I remember being on the field after it was over. All the competitors were done. I was the last one out there. And I could not leave. I could not bring myself to go and sit with my family at a table so far on the edge of the feast you could barely even see the bride. And I could not bear to tell them what it had been like squiring for you, when I knew that they could never have the faintest idea what I was talking about. I understand completely. How could you? Sorry, I I did not mean to doubt you. It just that I I was 16 once. I also had to replace someone squire on short notice. Which knight was it? Barristan Selmy. The fight against the Kingswood Outlaws. Before your time. What was he like? He was A painter. A painter who only used red. I could not imagine being able to fight like that, not back then. And to help him do that, to be a part of something that perfect. I do not need to explain how that felt, not to you. It hard to put into words. It like stepping into a dream you have been dreaming for as long as you can remember, and finding out that the dream is more real than your life. (nods) Leaving that battlefield was like being dragged off to prison. Did you squire for him again? No. I did not have your gift. He could not take a step without stepping on me. I was awful, a complete liability. Until one of the outlaws decided to take on a 16-year-old squire. (smiles) It a good thing I am who I am. I would have been useless at anything else. I am not well-suited for imprisonment. Shocking, I know. Some men are. Ned Stark, I imagine he made an excellent prisoner right up until the end. Not me, though. My life has left me uniquely unfit for constraint. And have you thought about Of course. Every day. And? Good prisoners breed good jailers, apparently. The Starks are very careful. (nods) But there is a way, I think. It was not possible until now. What is it? It actually quite simple. Well, let me help you. You will only have to do one thing. Tell me. You will have to die.

Specific_Stories: Daenerys Targaryen- Daenerys at Qarth-Daenerys and her dragons
Scene_Texts: I did not leave the comfort of home to come to yours and be called a thief. No one is calling you a thief. Who is she to accuse us? Please, they are my children. I am begging you. Begging us? It was not very long ago you were threatening us. Without me, the dragons will die. It will be for the best. Your dragons will bring the world nothing but death and misery, my dear. If I knew where they were, I would not tell you. You are cruel, my friend. The Mother of Dragons is in the right. She must be reunited with her babies. I will help you, Khaleesi. How? I will take you to the House of the Undying where I have put them. You have my dragons? When I learned you were coming to our city, I made an arrangement with the King He procured them for me. But there is no King There is now. That was the other half of the arrangement. You would keep your gates and your minds closed to everything outside your walls, but Qarth cannot remain the greatest city that ever was if it refuses to change. I will open Qarth to the world as I have forced it to open itself to me. Your ambition is an inspiration. But like all upstarts, you overreach. Three dragons the size of cats and an alliance with a charlatando not make you a king An upstart and a charlatan? Empires have been built by less. Those on the margins often come to control the center, and those in the center make room for them, willingly or otherwise. The Mother of Dragons will be with her babies. She will give them her love and they will thrive by her side, forever. A mother should be with her children. Where will you run to, Daenerys Stormborn? Your dragons wait for you in the House of the Undying. Come see them.

Scene_Texts: Get back! I want his head! Any man who stands between a father and his vengeance asks for death. Lord Karstark, this man is our prisoner. This monsterkilled my son And crippled mine. He will answer for his crimes, I promise you, but not here. I will have his head. And if you try and stop me You will strike me down? Have you forgotten me, ser? I am the widow of your liege, Lord Eddard Stark. I am the mother of your king And where is our king You know very well. He has gone to the Crag to accept the surrender. Aye, gone to the Crag, but not to negotiate. He brought that foreign bitch with him. How dare you! Threatening my lady is an act of treason. Treason? How can it be treason to kill Lannisters? I understand your grief, my lord, better than most, I understand it. But in the name of my sonthe King When your son Wise men do not make demands of kings. Fathers who love their sons do. I will have his head. Thank you for fighting on my behalf, Lady Stark. I would have come to your defense, but Take him to the stockades. Bind him with every chain you can find! You have become a real she-wolf in your later years. There not much fish left in you. And gag him!

Scene_Texts: Since I decided that I ca not stand to look at any of my handmaidens for another instant. How many times can you read one raven scroll? Stannis Baratheon fleet has been spotted sailing north past Tarth, 200 ships. More than we have. Yes, that more than we have. He will be at our gates within five days, four if he has the wind. We have strong, high walls. We will rain fire down on them from above. " Rain fire on them from above. " You are quoting Father Why not? He has a good mind for strategy, does not he? Call it tactics, not strategy. But, yes, he does have a good mind for it. The best mind, some would say. Sadly, he not here. It just you, me and Joffrey, the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm. I am sure you will make a point eventually. He needs to start acting like a king This war you started is coming to our doorstep. And if the entire city wants Joffrey dead I am not the one giving the boy whores to abuse. I thought the girls might help him. Did you? I was wrong. If we ca not control him Do you think I have not tried? He does not listen to me. It hard to put a leash on a dog once you have put a crown on its head. I always hoped he would be like Jaime. He looks like him. In a certain light. The boy Robert was a drunken fool, but he did not enjoy cruelty. Sometimes I wonder. What? If this is the price for what we have done, for our sins. Sins? The Targaryens Wed brother and sister for hundreds of years, I know. That what Jaime and I would say to each other in our moments of doubt. It what I told Ned Stark when he was stupid enough to confront me. Half the Targaryens went mad, did not they? What the saying? " Every time a Targaryen is born, the Gods flip a coin. " You have beaten the odds. Tommen and Myrcella are good, decent children, both of them.

I believe it my last night in this world. Is that a woman? Do you hear them out there? They want your head. Old Lord Karstark does not seem to like me. You strangled his son Oh. Oh. Was he the one on guard duty? He was in my way. Any knight would have done the same. You are no knight. You have forsaken every vow you ever took. So many vows. They make you swear and swear. Defend the king, obey the king, obey your father, protect the innocent, defend the weak. But what if your fatherdespises the king No matter what you do, you are forsaking one vow or another. Where did you find this beast? She is a truer knight than you will ever be, Kingslayer. Kingslayer. What a king Here to Aerys Targaryen, the Second of His Name, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, Protector of the Realm, and to the sword I shoved in his back. You are a man without honor. Do you know, I have never been with any woman but Cersei. So in my own way, I have more honor than poor old dead Ned. What was the name of that bastard Brienne. No, that was not it. Snow, a bastard Now, when When good old Ned came home with some whore baby, did you pretend to love it? No. You are not very good at pretending. You are an honest woman. Scene_Texts: Open the gate! Why, it the Prince of Winterfell. Envy is not attractive. What envy? You should be proud of your brother achievement. I took the great castle of Winterfell with 20 men. You are a great warrior. I saw the bodies above your gates. Which one gave you the tougher fight, the crippleor the six-year-old I treated the Stark boys with honor, and they repaid me with treachery. You treated them with honor? By butchering them? Before I had to kill them, - I treated them - You seized their home, as is your right. We are ironborn, we take what we need. Exactly. Then you made them prisoners in their home and they ran away. Is that treachery? I would call it bravery. They made me a promise Your little boy prisoners made you a promise and you got mad when they broke it? Are you the dumbest cunt alive? Do not call me A cunt. A dumb cunt who killed the only two Starks in Winterfell. You know how valuable those boys were? If I had not killed them, the Northerners would think me weak. You are weak. And you are stupid. I am warning you. Go on, then. Warn me. You have not brought enough men. How am I supposed to defend Winterfell with just this lot? You are not. I have come to bring you home. Father Is this a joke? Winterfell is the heart of the North. Aye, it is, hundreds of miles from the sea. We are islanders, baby brother. Had you forgotten that? Our power comes from our ships. And now that you have decorated your walls with the bodies of the Stark boys, every man in the North wants to see you hanged. When Robb Stark finds out He will not find out. We have killed all the ravens. We have all the horses. I have taken Winterfell. And I will keep Winterfell. (to her men) Leave us. Theon, you are my blood. We both loved our mother We both endured our father Come home with me. Do not die here alone. I do not intend to die. You were a terrible baby, do you know that? Bawling all the time, never sleeping. And one night, you just would not shut up, screaming like a dying pig. I walked over to your crib, I looked down at you. I wanted to strangle you. And you looked up at me and you stopped screaming. You smiled at me. Do not die so far from the sea.

Scene_Texts: Is she beautiful? I have never met her. What her name? Frey I do not know her first name. I am sure you will be very happy. And you are marrying her for a bridge? An important bridge. Ah. It was before they killed my father I still thought I could march south and rescue him in time, but only if I crossed that bridge. When I speak to people from the North, they all loved your father He was the best man I ever met. I know children always think that about their fathers, but Children do not always think that about their fathers, believe me. He once told me that being a lord is like being a father, except you have thousands of children and you worry about all of them. The farmers plowing the fields are yours to protect. The charwomen scrubbing the floors, yours to protect. The soldiers you order into battle. He told me he woke with fear in the morning and went to bed with fear in the night. I did not believe him. I asked him, " How can a man be brave if he afraid? " " That is the only time a man can be brave, " he told me. I wish I could have met him. He would have liked you. (chuckles) Most lords worry more about their gold and their glory than the charwomen scrubbing their floors. He did not care much about gold or glory. And you? You think I am fighting this war so they will sing songs about me? I want to go home. I want the men following me to go home. Then why do not you? Because we will never be safe until the Lannisters are defeated. And because I believe in justice. Chopping off Joffrey head, you mean. That would be a start. Your Grace, milady. The Kingslayer, he escaped in the night. How? How?

Scene_Texts: Tell me this is not true. Why? For the girls. You betrayed me. Robb No! You knew I would not allow it and you did it anyway. Bran and Rickon are captives in Winterfell. Sansa and Arya are captives in King Landing. I have five children, and only one of them is free. I lost one son fighting by your son side. I lost another to the Kingslayer, strangled with a chain. You commit treason because your children are prisoners? I would carve out my heart and offer it to the Father, if he would let my sons wake from their graves and step into a prison cell. I grieve for your sons, my lord. I do not want your grief. I want my vengeance. And you stole it from me. Killing Jaime Lannister would not buy life for your children, but returning him to King Landing may buy life for mine. Jaime Lannister has played you for a fool. You have weakened our position. You have brought discord into our camp. And you did it all behind my back. Make sure she guarded day and night. Robb. How many men did we send in pursuit of the Kingslayer? Forty, Your Grace. Send another 40 with our fastest horses. Robb.

Scene_Texts: Damn. You are much uglier in daylight. What your name? I am Jaime Lannister of Casterly Rock, son of Tywin. A captive knight has a right to know his captor identity. Brienne of Tarth. Tarth, Tarth, Tarth. Crescent moons and starbursts. Lord Selwyn Tarth. Your father. Do you have any brothers and sisters, my lady? It a long way to King Landing. Might as well get to know one another. Have you known many men? I suppose not. Women? Horses? Ah. I did not mean to give offense, my lady. Forgive me. Your crimes are past forgiveness, Kingslayer. Why do you hate me so much? Have I ever harmed you? You have harmed others, those you were sworn to protect, the weak, the innocent. Has anyone ever told you you are as boring as you are ugly? You will not provoke me to anger. I already have. Look at you. You are ready to chop my head off. Do you think you could? Do you think you could beat me in a fair fight? I have never seen you fight. The answer is no. There are three men in the kingdoms who might have a chance against me. You are not one of them. All my life men like you have sneered at me. And all my life I have been knocking men like you into the dust. If you are so confident, unlock my chains. Let see what happens. Do you take me for an idiot? In! I took you for a fighter, a man Pardon. Woman of honor. Was I wrong? You are afraid. Maybe one day we will find out, Kingslayer.

Stannis, two days from the capital and the wolf at my doorstep. The scouts assure us Robb Stark remains north of Ashemark. Ha! The last time the scouts assured us of Stark movement, he lured us into a trap. Which is why my son is his prisoner. Too close to Casterly Rock. He sent a splinter force to recapture Winterfell. The Greyjoys have done us a great favor. Stark will not risk marching on Casterly Rock until he at full force. He a boy He will risk anything at any time because he does not know enough to be afraid. We will ride at nightfall. I want a full night march before he knows we are on the move. Clegane, you will maintain a garrison here at Harrenhal. Track down this brotherhood and destroy them. Scene_Texts: I like to keep me hands clean. Yes, but do you have to do it here? You should start wearing the gold cloak. I do not want to wear a gold cloak. You are commander of the City Watch. You should not be dressed like a common A cloak slows you down in a fight. Makes it hard to move quietly. And the gold catches the light, so you are nice and easy to spot at night. Well, you are not sneaking through alleyways any longer. You are supposed to stand out. We had a deal and wearing a gold cloak was not part of it. Fine, fine. No gold cloak. What? What? What? What? Why are you staring at me? (scoffs) You do not want me cleaning me nails. You do not want me looking your way. Why am I here? To help me plan the defense of King Landing. Stannis will be here any day. And one of these explains how to beat him? " An History of the Great Sieges of Westeros. " By Archmaester Shevelathin. Shevelatesh. Chevalteesh. I would swap all your books for a few good archers. My Lord HandCommander I must compliment you on the gold cloaks' performance these last few weeks. Did you know there has been a marked drop in thievery? I did not know. And how did you accomplish this marked drop in thievery? Me and the lads rounded up all the known thieves. For questioning? No. It just the unknown thieves we need to worry about now. We talked about this. Aye, we talked about it. Have you ever been in a city under siege? Maybe this part not in your books. See, it not the fighting that kills most people. It the starving. Food worth more than gold. Noble ladies sell their diamonds for a sack of potatoes. Things get bad enough, the poor start eating each other. The thieves, they love a siege. Soon as the gates are sealed, they steal all the food. By the time it all over, they are the richest men in town. Given the circumstances, my lord, I believe extreme measures are warranted. (nods) Ah. " The Great Sieges of Westeros. " Thrilling subject. Shame Archmaester Ch'Vyalthan was not a better writer. Stannis knows King Landing. He knows where the walls are strongest, and he knows which gates are weakest. The Mud Gate. A good ram will batter it down in minutes, and it only 50 yards from the water. That where he will land. And if Stannis does attack the Mud Gate, what is our plan? We could throw books at his men. We do not have that many books. We do not have that many men, either. What do we have? Pig shit.

Scene_Texts: Thank you, Podrick. Odd little boy. I have a certain sympathy for odd little boys. You and Varys both. Excellent lamprey pie. Were you slaving away in the kitchen all day? I hear Joffrey plans on fighting. An inspiration for the troops. The young king in his shining armor fighting to defend the capital against the wicked old rebel. He only a boy. Younger boys are off fighting his war. He not ready. What is he, 17? Remember Jaime at 17? Better than you. Some men have a gift for this sort of thing, some do not. His place is not on the battlefield. It not on the throne, either, sadly for all of us. Do you think I am an idiot? No, I would say you possess above-average intelligence. You shipped off my only daughter And now you want to send my eldest son He will have his Kingsguard protecting him. He has the finest armor gold can buy. He needs to be out there. The men will fight more fiercely seeing their king fighting beside them instead of hiding behind his mother skirts. Any dessert? Do you know why Varys is so dangerous? Because he has thousands of spies in his employ. Because he knows everything we do before we do it. Because he does not have a cock. Neither do you. Perhaps I am dangerous, too. You, on the other hand, are as big a fool as every other man. That little worm between your legs does half your thinking. It not that little. (laughs) Why are you smiling? Because I am happy. And why are you happy? Because I have your little whore I thought you preferred blondes. Such a droll little fellow. Tell me, have you married this one yet? No? Good. Father Why do you care who I fuck? Because a Lannister always pays her debts. You stole my only daughter This is madness. Stannis will be here in days. You need me. For what? Your skill in battle? Pretty thing, your whore Lovely body. The bruises will heal in time. Where did you find her? Varys is not the only one who hears whispers. Really, a Lannister lion necklace? You need to hide your secret whores more carefully. You have forgotten the most important thing about whores. Oh? Well, you are the expert. Tell me. You do not buy them, you only rent them. You are usually a better liar, baby brother This one you like. You like her very much. Could it be love? Do not worry, she will be treated gently enough. Unless Joffrey is hurt. And then every wound he suffers, she will suffer, too. And if he dies, there is not a man alive who could devise a more painful death for your little cunt And how do I know you have not killed her already? Would you like to see her? I thought you might. Ser Mandon, bring in my brother I am sorry they hurt you. You must be brave. I promise I will free you. Do not forget me. Never. I will hurt you for this. A day will come when you think you are safe and happy, and your joy will turn to ashes in your mouth. And you will know the debt is paid. Get out.

Scene_Texts: Still no word? We have sent a dozen ravens. None have returned. My bastard Once he captures the castle Theon has my brothers. If we storm the castle He would not dare hurt the boys. They are his only hope of escaping the North with his head. Send word to your son. Any ironborn who surrender will be allowed to return safely to their homes. A touch of mercy is a virtue, Your Grace. Too much Any ironborn with the exception of Theon Greyjoy. He betrayed our cause. He betrayed me. And we will hunt him down no matter where he runs. I expect his countrymen will turn on him the minute they hear the offer. Your pardon, my lord. Your Grace. My lady. How are you? How am I? I have had to arrest my mother The Lannisters have my sisters. The man I considered my closest friend has seized my home and my brothers. I am fighting a war and I do not know if I should march south or north. I am sorry. It was a stupid question. I am sorry. No. Forgive me. You are being kind. I have no right. You have every right. You are a king That not the kind of king I want to be. What kind do you want to be? I do not know. The good kind. Most kings grew up as princes. They spend their whole lives preparing for the crown. I was raised to be Lord I was raised to be a proper little lady, to play the harp and dance the latest steps and recite Valyrian poetry. I would like to hear you play the harp. No. No, you would not. How did you go from reciting Valyrian poetry to sawing off men feet? When I was 12, my mother and father went to a wedding. Weddings in Volantis last for days, you know. And they left me with my little brother. The second afternoon they were gone was the hottest day in the three-year summer. We could not bear to be inside, so we ran down to the Rhoyne. Every child in Volantis was in the Rhoyne that day. The rich, the poor, we were all there. Naked, screaming, racing to the little islands. Drummers were playing for coppers on the east bank. I was treading water, talking to a friend, when I realized I had not seen my brother. I called his name. Then I started screaming his name. And then I saw him floating face down. My heart just stopped. I was I dragged him from the water. My friend helped me, I think. I do not even remember. He was so little. Then we pulled him onto the riverbank. And I screamed at him and I shook him. And he was dead. Just dead. A man ran over. He had a fish tattoo on his face. In Volantis, the slaves have tattoos. So you know what they are without having to talk to them. And this man worked on a fishing boat. And he pushed me out of the way. You have to understand, for a slave to push a highborn girl, that death for the man, a terrible death. But he pushed me out of the way, and he started pressing on my brother chest again and again and again, until my brother spat out half of the Rhoyne and cried out. And the man cradled his head and told him to be calm. I decided two things that day. I would not waste my years planning dances and masquerades with the other noble ladies. And when I came of age, I would never live in a slave city again. I am sorry, Your Grace. You told me of your problems and I have blathered on. I do not want to marry the Frey girl I do not want you to marry her. But you needed that bridge. I hope it a very beautiful bridge.
Scene_Keybords: valyrian slave brother push poetri tattoo kind rhoyne scream

Scene_Tiitles: Stannis Baratheon's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Stannis Baratheon- Stannis claim to the throne-Stannis against Joffrey
Scene_Texts: Away! Reset! If the wind holds, we will reach King Landing in a day. Will it hold? Ca not make promises for the wind, Your Grace. Again, pull! I admire you, Ser Davos. I thank you, Your Grace. Pleased to hear it. Some highborn fools call you Onion Knight and think they insult you. So you take the onion for your sigil, sew it on your coat, fly the onion flag. My son Three mermen with tridents, something like that. I understand why the older families look down at me. Do you? Why? My father And? Well, sons of lords do not like to break bread with sons of crabbers. Our hands stink. And where were those lords when Storm End starved? Many fought bravely for your brother Many fought for the Mad King. You defend these men who insult you behind your back. Some are happy to do it to my face. We were forgotten. Robert and Ned Stark, they were the heroes. The glorious rebels marching from battle to battle, liberating towns from the yoke of the Mad King, while I held Storm End with 500 men. No one has forgotten, Your Grace. No? Robert did. He gave Storm End to Renly after the war. Renly never fought a day in his life. He was only a boy Then why would he give him Storm End? (exhales) First, we ate the horses. We were not riding anywhere, not with the castle surrounded. We could not feed them, so fine, the horses. Then the cats. Never liked cats. So fine. I do like dogs. Good animals. Loyal. But we ate them. Then the rats. The night before you slipped through, I thought my wife She could not speak anymore, she was so frail. And then you made it through the lines. Slipped right through in your little black sailboat with your onions. And potatoes. Some salted beef, I believe. Every man in Storm End wanted to kiss you that night. I was relieved they did not. Robert told me to hold Storm End, so I held it. Then he told me he was giving it to Renly, so I gave it up. Insult or no, I gave it up. Because Robert was my older brotherand he was the king But now, I am the rightful king And when I sit the Iron Throne, you will be my Hand Your Grace, I pray I serve you well. I expect you will be the first crabberson.

Specific_Stories: Tyrion Lannister-Tyrion as hand of the king-Stannis against Joffrey,Joffrey Baratheon-Joffrey as a king-Stannis against Joffrey
Scene_Texts: You are the Master of Whisperers. You are supposed to know everything. No man can be in all rooms at all times. I have many little birds in the North, my lord, but I have not heard their songs since Theon Greyjoy captured Winterfell. The Stark forces are distracted. Now is the time to strike. To strike? My dear nephew If my Uncle Stannis lands on the shores of King Landing, I will ride out to greet him. A brave choice, Your Grace. I am sure your men will line up behind you. They say Stannis never smiles. I will give him a red smile from ear to ear. Imagine Stannis' terror. I am trying. You are an intelligent man. I would like to think I am an intelligent man. Oh, no one disputes that, my lord, not even the multitudes who despise you. I wish we could converse as two honest, intelligent men. I wish we could, too. What do you want? Tell me. If we are going to play, you will have to start. My brother My sisterbecame queen When I reached manhood, my father A most highborn plumber. The water never flowed better. And all the shit found its way to the sea. I never expected to have any real power. So when my fathernamed me acting Hand You are quite good at being Hand, you know? Jon Arryn and Ned Stark were good men. Honorable men. But they disdained the game and those who played. - You enjoy the game. I do. Last thing I expected. And you play it well. I would like to keep playing it. If Stannis breaches the gates, the game is over. They say he burns his enemies alive to honor the Lord of Light. The Lord of Light wants his enemies burned, the Drowned God wants them drowned. Why are all the gods such vicious cunts? Where is the god of tits and wine? In the Summer Isles, they worship a fertility goddess with 16 teats. We should sail there immediately. This morning, I heard a song all the way from Qarth beyond the Red Waste. Daenerys Targaryen lives. A girl She has three dragons. But even if what they say is true, it will be years before they are fully grown. And then there will be nowhere to hide. One game at a time, my friend.

Scene_Tiitles: Daenerys Targaryen's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Daenerys Targaryen-Daenerys and her dragons
Scene_Texts: Careful, Khaleesi. Xaro owns this city and the warlocks have a thousand eyes watching for you. I found one. A ship with a good captain. She leaves for Astapor tomorrow. Astapor? We cannot stay here. They have my dragons. A mother does not flee without her children. They are not your children. I know they call you the Mother of Dragons and I know you love them, but you did not grow them in your womb. They did not suckle at your breast. They are dragons, Khaleesi. And if we stay in Qarth, we will die. You should sail to Astapor. I am sure you will be safe there. You know I would die for you. I will never abandon you. I am sworn to protect you, to serve. Then serve me. If my dragons are in the House of the Undying, then take me there. That what the warlock He told you so himself. If you enter that place, you will never leave again. His magic is strong. And what of my magic? You saw me step into the fire. You watched the witch What did the flames do to me? Do you remember? Until my last breath, I will remember. After I have forgotten my mother face. They are my children. And they are the only children I will ever have. Take me to them.

Specific_Stories: Stannis Baratheon- Stannis claim to the throne-Stannis against Joffrey
Scene_Texts: That is it. The tide against us. Aye, but we have the wind. She will blow us straight to the gates. You are coming home. King Landing has not been home for 20 years. I spent most of my life dodging the royal fleet. And now I am sailing right at them. This is the royal fleet. And you are not a smuggler anymore, you are the high captain. Of course, there are several royal fleets at the moment. Not after tonight. When the sun rises, Stannis will sit on the Iron Throne and you will be his Hand. Gods be good. God. Father But not over them? Over all of us. The people of King Landing did not choose the false king, Joffrey Baratheon. They will be glad to see his head on a spike. Well, first, we have to put it there. Our ships outnumber theirs 10-to-1. Our army outnumber theirs 5-to-1. Those walls have never been breached, and the men guarding the walls, when they see you, they do not see a liberator, they see a stranger come to set their city on fire. I have faith in the Lord of Light. I have faith in our cause. And I have faith in my captain.

Specific_Stories: Tyrion Lannister-Tyrion as hand of the king-Stannis against Joffrey
Scene_Texts: I have always hated the bells. They ring for horror. A dead king, a city under siege. A wedding. Exactly. Podrick, is that it? " Is that it? " Nice touch. As if you do not know the name of every boy in town. I am not entirely sure what you are suggesting. I am entirely sure you are entirely sure what I am suggesting. Do you trust him? Oddly enough, I do. Good. The map you asked for. There must be 20 miles of tunnels beneath the city. Closer to 50. The Targaryens built this city to withstand a siege and to provide escape if necessary. I am not escaping. Strange as it sounds, I am the captain of the ship, and if the ship goes down, I go with her. That is good to hear. Though I am sure many captains say the same while their ship is afloat. You look well suited for battle, my lord. Well, I am not. For all our sakes, I hope you are wrong. My little birds tell me that Stannis Baratheon has taken up with a red priestess What of it? You do not believe in the old powers, my lord? Blood spells, curses, shape-shifting. What do you think? I think you believe in what you see and in what those you trust have seen. You probably do not entirely trust me. Mmm, do not take it personally. I do not entirely trust myself. And yet I have seen things and heard things, things you have not, things I wish I had not. I do not believe I have ever told you how I was cut. No, I do not believe you have. One day, I will. The dark arts have provided Lord Stannis with his armies and paved his path to our door. For a man in service to such powers to sit on the Iron Throne, I can think of nothing worse. And tonight, I believe you are the only man who can stop him.

That why they are gods. My father My mother I did not really understand the concept of death, the finality of it. I thought that if I prayed very, very hard, the gods would return my mother I was four. Your father He believes in them, he just does not like them very much. One for her. Here. Sit. Drink. Not like that. Drink, girl I should have been born a man. I would rather face a thousand swords than be shut up inside with this flock of frightened hens. They are your guests under your protection. You asked them here. It was expected of me, as it will be of you if you ever become Joffrey queen If my wretched brother should somehow prevail, these hens will return to their cocks and crow of how my courage inspired them, lifted their spirits. And if the city should fall? You would like that, would not you? The Red Keep should hold for a time, long enough for me to go to the walls and yield to Lord Stannis in person. If it were anyone else outside those gates, I might have hoped for a private audience, but this is Stannis Baratheon. I would have a better chance of seducing his horse. Have I shocked you, little dove The best one between your legs. Learn how to use it. Drink. Do you have any notion of what happens when a city is sacked? No, you would not, would you? If the city falls, these fine women should be in for a bit of a rape. Half of them will have bastards in their bellies come the morning. You will be glad of your red flower then. Scene_Texts: When we were young, Jaime and I, we looked so much alike even our father could not tell us apart. I could never understand why they treated us differently. Jaime was taught to fight with sword and lance and mace, and I was taught to smile and sing and please. He was heir to Casterly Rock, and I was sold to some stranger like a horse to be ridden whenever he desired. You were Robert queen. And you will be Joffrey. Enjoy. I do not think I know this one. Pretty. That the worst curtsy I have ever seen. Here, it not difficult. I mastered it when I was four. Straighten your back and bend. Better. You learn fast. How long have you been in Lady Sansa service? A few weeks, Your Grace. When did you leave Lorath? I had a Lorathi handmaiden once. (smiles) But she was a nobleman daughter. You are not. When did you come to Westeros? Ten years ago, Your Grace. From Lorathi commoner to the Red Keep in 10 years, all without learning how to curtsy. I imagine that a very interesting story. What your name? Shae, Your Grace. Tell us a story, Shae. When I was 13, I Your Grace! What news? The Imp has set the river afire. Hundreds of ships are burning, maybe more. Stannis' fleet destroyed, but But But his troops have landed outside the city walls. Where is Joffrey? On the battlements with Lord Tyrion. Bring him back inside at once. Your Grace What? The king Bring him back to his chambers now. Not here? With the women and children? Do you want him to be mocked as a coward for the rest of his life? No, but I Now! When I told you about Ser llyn earlier, I lied. Do you want to hear the truth? You want to know why he really here? He here for us. Stannis may take the city, he may take the throne, but he will not take us alive.

Scene_Texts: Help me! Fall back! Fall back! Get the ladders up! Faster, you bastards! Faster! Come on, kill the scum! Someone bring me a drink. Fuck the water. Bring me wine. Can I get you some iced milk and a nice bowl of raspberries, too? Eat shit, dwarf. You are on the wrong side of the wall. I lost half my men. The Blackwater on fire. Dog, I command you to go back out there and fight. You are Kingsguard, Clegane. You must beat them back or they are going to take this city. Your king Fuck the Kingsguard. Fuck the city. Fuck the king Loose! Put your backs into it! All right, get up! Loose! Clear! Forward! Loose! Forward ladders! Heave! Heave! Your Grace, the queen If you will not defend your own city, why should they? What would you have me do? Lead. Get down there and lead your people against the invaders who want to kill them. What did my mother She did not say, Your Grace. All men to the battlements! Ser Boros, Ser Mandon, stay with my uncleand represent the king (nods) Archers, hold your line or I will kill you myself. Stand fast! No! Get up, you fool. We need more arrows! Where is the king? Why is not he with us? Who are we fighting for? Who leads us? I will lead the attack. I will lead the attack! Yes. What are you talking about? Pod, my helmet. Ser Mandon, you will bear the king banner. Men, form up. Men Men! They say I am half a man. But what does that make the lot of you? The only way out is through the gates. And they are at the gates. There another way out. I am going to show you. We will come out behind them and fuck them in their arses. Heave! Heave! Do not fight for your king and do not fight for his kingdoms. Do not fight for honor. Do not fight for glory. Do not fight for riches, because you will not get any. This is your city Stannis means to sack. That your gate he ramming. If he gets in, it will be your houses he burns, your gold he steals, your women he will rape. Heave! Heave! Heave! Those are brave men knocking at our door. Let go kill them.

Scene_Tiitles: Joffrey Baratheon's Journey-Joffrey Baratheon as a King,Petry Baelish's Journey, Tyrion Lannister's Journey-Tyrion Lannister as king's hand,Margaery journey,Sansa Stark's Journey
Specific_Stories: Joffrey Baratheon-Joffrey as a king-Joffrey appointing officials, Sansa Stark-Sansa and Petyr
Scene_Texts: I, Joffrey of the House Baratheon, first of my name, the rightful King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm, do hereby proclaim my grandfatherTywin Lannister, the savior of the city and the Hand Thank you, Your Grace. Lord Petry Baelish, step forward. For your good service and ingenuity in uniting the Houses of Lannister and Tyrell, I declare that you shall be granted the castle of Harrenhal with all its attendant lands and incomes to be held by your sons and grandsons from this day until the end of time. You honor me beyond words, Your Grace. I shall have to acquire some sons and grandsons. The crowd laughs Ser Loras Tyrell. Your house has come to our aid. The whole realm is in your debt, none more so than I. If your family would ask anything of me, ask it, and it shall be yours. Your Grace, my sister Margaery, her husband I would ask you to find it in your heart to do us the great honor of joining our houses. Is this what you want, Lady Margaery? With all my heart, Your Grace. I have come to love you from afar. Tales of your courage and wisdom have never been far from my ears. And those tales have taken root deep inside of me. I, too, have heard tales of your beauty and grace, but the tales do not do you justice, my lady. It would be an honor to return your love, but I am promised to another. A king Your Grace, in the judgment of your Small Council, it would be neither proper nor wise for you to wed the daughter of a manbeheaded for treason, a girlwhose brother For the good of the realm, your councilors beg you to set Sansa Stark aside. Margaery! We want Margaery! I would like to heed your wishes and the wishes of my people, but I took a holy vow. Your Grace, the gods do indeed hold betrothal solemn, but your father I have consulted with the High Septon and he assures me that their crimes against the realm free you from any promise you have made to them in the sight of the gods. The gods are good. I am free to heed my heart. Ser Loras, I will gladly wed your sweet sister You will be my queen My lady. My sincerest condolences. They are right. I am not good enough for him. You should not say that. You will be good enough for many things. He will still enjoy beating you. And now that you are a woman, he will be able to enjoy you in other ways as well. But, if he not marrying me He will let you go home? Joffrey not the sort of boy who gives away his toys. You have a tender heart, just like your mother I can see so much of her in you. She was like a sister to me. For her sake, I will help get you home. King Landing is my home now. Look around you. We are all liars here. And every one of us is better than you.
Scene_Keybords: tale house would heart grandson heed good son realm grace

Scene_Texts: Come in. Make yourself comfortable. That does not look very comfortable. Here, watch me. No need for that, my dear. You sure? Most men like what they see. I am not like most men. That what most men say. (laughs) If you do not want what most men want, then you would better tell me what you would like me to do. I would like you to tell me if working for Lord Baelish has been all you would hoped it would be. Have we met? You would not remember me if we had? I meet a lot of men. And I think you remember all of them. I think your true talents are wasted on them. You are very kind, my lord. Allow me to return the favor. You are afraid. Why? Nothing dangerous down there. I know who you are. And, unlike your current employer, I protect those who work for me. I do not abuse them to satisfy royal whims or force them to abuse each other. How do you know about that? I thought you said you knew who I was. What can I do for you, Lord Varys? Littlefinger looks at you and sees a collection of profitable holes. I see a potential partner. I am afraid of him. Oh, you should be. He a dangerous man. But everyone has their weaknesses. Your current employer hides his very well, but not as well as he thinks.

Scene_Texts: You are a virgin, I take it? Walk. Childhood must have been awful for you. Were you a foot taller than all the boys? They laughed at you, called you names? Some boys like a challenge. But maybe you wished one of them could overpower you, fling you down, tear off your clothes. But none of them were strong enough. I am strong enough. Not interested. Of course you are. You would love to know what it feels like to be a woman. Ah. " They lay with lions. " Tavern girls, I would say. Probably served my father Maybe one of them gave up a kiss and a feel. That how they earned this. The glorious work of the Northern freedom fighters. Must make you proud to serve the Starks. I do not serve the Starks. I serve Lady Catelyn. Tell yourself that tonight when they swing in your dreams. What are you doing? Burying them. We should not stay here. We should get back on the river. I think these women would understand if I do not care what you think. I did not leave it here. I had me dagger. Untie me. Now! I gave it to you to cut the rope, and now I do not have me dagger no more. So unless it got stuck in your arse on its way to your cunt, it stands to reason that it gone. Whoa. What your business here? Traveling a prisoner You are a woman. - A woman! Well, fuck me! If you have quite finished up All right, we will be going. Whoa. Whoa! Who do you fight for? The Starks. What did he do? Apparently eating is now a crime. Who knew? No, stealing is a crime. But it not a crime to starve. That justice for you. Where are you taking him? To Riverrun. Why Riverrun? Steal from the Tullys, it their dungeons you rot in. Why not kill him? For stealing a pig? I do not give the orders. He must be important to someone. Sending him with you? How important could he be? All right, have it your way, my lady. Do I know you? Have you been to Ashemark? No. Then you do not know me. Do you ever go to the river market at Salt Rock? Is it near Ashemark? No. I have never been there. What do you think of these beauties? I hope you gave them quick deaths. Two of them we did, yeah. Wait. I do know you. That Jaime Lannister. I wish someone had told me. I would not have had to steal that pig. If this is the Kingslayer, I think I would know about it. How do you know what the Kingslayer looks like? I was at Whispering Wood. I saw him. They dragged him out of the woods and threw him down before the king He not the Kingslayer. Sorry to disappoint you. If he was, I would only be traveling his head. I have a question for you both. And I want you to answer it at the same time. I count to three, you both answer. What his name? One. Two. Three. Two quick deaths. Those were Stark men. I do not serve the Starks. I serve Lady Catelyn. I told you I would take you to King Landing, and that what I am going to do. Stay.

Scene_Tiitles: Stannis Baratheon's claim to the throne
Specific_Stories: Stannis Baratheon- Stannis claim to the throne-Stannis defeat
Scene_Texts: You said you saw my victory in the flames. l I did. I still see it. The flames lied. And I am no better than a savage trusting in a fire god. I fought for your god in Blackwater Bay. I led my men to the gates of the seventh hell as their brothers burned alive, and for what? Attacked from behind by Tywin Lannister and the Tyrells. If you see so much in your flames, why did not you warn me? The Lord of Light only allows me glimpses. You claimed to speak for a god. Will you quit the war just because you have lost a battle? You talk about war as if you understand it. I have been fighting far longer than you. Have you? Show me how you fight. Show me. Where your god now? Will he save you? Where is your god? Inside you. I murdered my brother We murdered him. Share the weight with me. He was not your brother This war has just begun. It will last for years. Thousands will die at your command. You will betray the men serving you. You will betray your family. You will betray everything you once held dear. And it will all be worth it because you are the Son of Fire. You are the Warrior of Light. You will sweep aside this pretender and that one. You will be king You promise these things, but you do not know. None of us know. Let me show you. Look into the fire, my king Look. I see fire. Keep looking. Do you see? Do you see, my king

Scene_Texts: I will kill that man. I do not care how many arrows they feather me with, how many spears they run through me, I will kill that horn-blowing cunt before I fall. They want you to know you are surrounded. I know I am surrounded. I know that because I stood on the battlements and saw I was surrounded. They do not want you to sleep. They want to sap your spirit before Thank you, wise bald man Thank you for explaining siege tactics to me. No word from my father No. Send more ravens. You killed all the ravens. The first time I saw Winterfell First time I saw Winterfell, it looked like something that had been here for thousands of years and would be here for thousands of years after I was dead. I saw it and I thought, " Of course, Ned Stark crushed our rebellion and killed my brothers. " We never stood a chance against the man who lives here. " Lord Stark Yes, my captors were so very kind to me. You love reminding me of that. Everyone in this frozen pile of shit has always loved reminding me of that. You know what it like to be told how lucky you are to be someone prisoner? To be told how much you owe them? And then to go back home to your real father I will kill that man. I swear to the Drowned God, the Old Gods, the New Gods, to every fucking god in every fucking heaven, I will kill that man. Theon, listen to me. I serve Winterfell. Now Winterfell is yours. I am bound by oath to serve you. And what your counsel, trusted friend Run. Five hundred Northmen wait outside the walls. You have 20 men. You ca not win. Wait for nightfall and run. There nowhere to run. I would never make it back to the Iron Islands. And even if I did, even if by some miracle I slipped through the lines and made it home, I would be a coward. The Greyjoy who ran. The shame of the family. Do not go home. Join the Night Watch. Once a man has taken the black, he beyond reach of the law. All his past crimes are forgiven. I will not make it to the Wall. I will not make it 10 feet past the Winterfell gates. There are ways. Hidden passageways built so the Lords of Winterfell could escape. The road will be dangerous. But with a little luck... The Night Watch is an ancient, honorable order. You will have opportunities there. The opportunity for Jon Snow to cut my throat in my sleep. The opportunity to make amends for what you have done. I have done a lot, have not I? Things I never imagined myself doing. I have known you many years, Theon Greyjoy. You are not the man you are pretending to be. Not yet. You may be right. But I have gone too far to pretend to be anything else.

Scene_Texts: You hear that? That the mating call of the Northmen. They want to fuck us. Well, I have not had a good fuck in weeks. I am ready for one. They say every ironborn man is worth a dozen from the mainland. Aye! You think they are right? Aye. We die today, brothers. We die bleeding from 100 wounds with arrows in our necks and spears in our guts, but our war cries will echo through eternity. They will sing about the battle of Winterfell until the Iron Islands have slipped beneath the waves. Every man, woman and child will know who we were and how long we stood. Aggar and Gelmarr, Wex and Urzen, Stygg and Black Lorren. Ironborn warriors will cry out our names as they leap onto the shores of Seagard and Faircastle. Aye! Mothers will name their sons for us. Aye! Girls will think of us with their lovers inside them. Aye! And whoever kills that fucking horn-blower will stand in bronze above the shores of Pyke! Aye! What is dead may never die! What is dead may never die! Thought he would never shut up. It was a good speech. Did not want to interrupt. What is this? What are you doing? Let go home. Come on.

(nods) I am afraid your friend The gold cloaks are now firmly in the hands of your fatheror your sister It varies from cloak to cloak. Then my hill tribesmen. Have gone home. Your father I am afraid we will not be seeing each other for some time, my lord. Do not want to swim too close to a drowning man? And I thought we were friends. We are. Podrick, would you mind? There are many who know that without you this city faced certain defeat. The king Come along now, Podrick. My love. It was good of you to come. Good of me? Of course I come. I want to see you. Believe me, you do not. Have you looked? (shakes his head) I will be the first. Well? You are a mess. I am a monster as well as a dwarf. You should charge me double. You think I am here for money? That was the arrangement we made. I pay you and you lie to me. Oh. I am a poor little rich man and nobody loves me, so I make jokes all the time and pay them to laugh. Fuck your money. Let leave. Leave? Leave King Landing. They tried to kill you. They will try again. Going into wars, fighting soldiers, you are terrible at this. Let take a boat to Pentos and never come back. You do not belong here. What would we do in Pentos? Eat, drink, fuck, live. I want to go with you. So do it. Your fatheryour sister Forget about them. Come with me. I ca not. I do belong here. These bad people are what I am good at. Outtalking them, outthinking them. It what I am. And I like it. I like it more than anything I have ever done. Are you going to leave? You have a shit memory. I am yours and you are mine.

Scene_Tiitles: Arya Stark's Journey
Specific_Stories: Arya Stark-Arya and Jaqen-Arya scaped
Scene_Texts: How did he find us? What are you doing here? Waiting for you. How did you know we would come this way? After all the things you have seen, this is your question? How did you kill those guards? Was it hard? No harder than taking a new name, if you know the way. Show me how. I want to be able to do it, too. If you would learn, you must come with me. Where? Far and away across the Narrow Sea to Braavos. My dancing master was from Braavos. To be a dancing master is a special thing, but to be a faceless man, that is something else entirely. The girl Joffrey, Cersei, Tywin Lannister, llyn Payne, the Hound. Names to offer up to the Red God. She could offer them all one by one. I want to. But I ca not. I need to find my brotherand mother And my sister I need to find her, too. Then we must part. A man What is it? A coin of great value. Could it buy a horse? It is not meant for the buying of horses. Then what good is it? If the day comes when you must find me again, just give that coin to any man from Braavos and say these words to him, " Valar Morghulis. " Valar Morghulis. Please do not go, Jaqen. Jaqen is dead. Say it again. Valar Morghulis. Valar Morghulis. Good. Farewell, Arya Stark.

Scene_Texts: Tell us what medicine to get from your chambers. We will make you better. LUWIN I feel just fine. They burned it down. They burned everything. Not everything. Not you. Scene_Texts: Moon of my life. This is dark magic, like the magic that took you from me. Took you from me before I could even Maybe I am dead and I just do not know it yet. Maybe I am with you in the Night Lands. Or maybe I refused to enter the Night Lands without you. Maybe I told the Great Stallion to go fuck himself and came back here to wait for you. That sounds like something you would do. Or maybe it is a dream. Your dream, my dream I do not know. These are questions for wise men with skinny arms. You are the moon of my life. That is all I know and all I need to know. And if this is a dream I will kill the man who tries to wake me. Until the sun rises in the west and sets in the east, until the rivers run dry and the mountains blow in the wind like leaves. They miss their mother. They want to be with you. Do you want to be with them? You will be. When your dragons were born, our magic was born again. It is strongest in their presence. And they are strongest in yours. You will be with them, through winter, summer, winter again. Across a thousand, thousand seasons you will be with them. And we will be with you until time comes to an end. Welcome home, Daenerys Stormborn. This is not my home. My home is across the sea, where my people are waiting for me. They will be waiting a long time. Dracarys.
